title: HR Model - Merged Schema
description: Merged JSON schema containing all HR model schemas with internal references

PositionType.title: PositionType
PositionType.description: A position which may be associated with a screening order.

ServiceReportType.title: ServiceReportType
ServiceReportType.description: The type of service or search type requested in the overall order.

serviceId.description: Typically used for a reference ID provided by the Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA) specific to the service itself.

serviceOrderDate.description: Order date and time when service was requested.

serviceCompletedDate.description: Completed date and time when service was completed.

serviceCode.description: Code used for service type.  Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

serviceName.description: Service Name used for service type.  Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

statusMessage.description: Overall status of service.  Typically would be reflective of a value like Pending, Complete, etc. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

flaggedIndicator.description: Typically a true or false value indicating whether or not the service is flagged.  For example, a value of 'true' may indicate flagged information was found. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

result.description: Overall result of service.  Typically would be reflective of a value like Record Found, No Record Found, etc. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

comments.description: Any additional comments or ETAs tied to service. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

attachmentPointers.description: This points to the an attachment in attachments array.

items.description: Indicates JSON Pointer value such as /foo/bar. Although this is a string, HR Open requires a json-pointer format. Do not use JSON Pointer URI fragments such as #/foo/bar

packageCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening package.

orderId.description: Typically used for a reference ID provided by the Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA) specific to the order itself. Can often be used as a lookup value in the CRA's client portal.

subjectId.description: Reference ID tied to the subject (consumer) being screened.

orderedDate.description: Date and time when order was successfully submitted.

completedDate.description: Completed date and time when overall order was completed.

overallEvaluation.description: Reflects overall evaluation of order for organizations using a CRA for scoring purposes.  Often reflects values like Pass, Needs Review, etc.

screeningResults.description: A collection of separate service results. For example, Education Verification, Employment Verification, MVR, Criminal Checks, etc.

statusMessage.description: Overall status of order.  Typically would be reflective of a value like Pending, Complete, etc. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

attachments.description: This points to the attachments array

screeningCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening type (e.g. MVR, Criminal, Civil, Credit, DrugTesting, Fingerprinting, Education, Employment).

screeningInstructions.description: The instructions of what should be done in the screening request.

subjectId.description: Reference to the subject required for the package.

packageCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening package.

aLaCarteItems.description: Individual screens that are part of this order.

purpose.description: The reason why this report is requested (e.g. Court Order/Subpoena, Employment, Insurance Underwriting).

referenceObject.description: Reference to the data required for the package.

DocketType.title: DocketType
DocketType.description: Includes properties common to court dockets

courtDocketNumber.description: The unique identifier supplied by the court.  Sometimes referred to as case number.

person.description: The person associated with the Docket

CriminalDocketType.title: CriminalDocketType
CriminalDocketType.description: Includes properties common to criminal court dockets

charges.description: The charges associated with the Docket

amendedCharge.description: A charge amended from the original offense

amendedOffenseClass.description: An offense class amended from the original offense class

amendedOffenseType.description: An offense type amended from the original offense type

amendedStatus.description: The status of the amended offense

appealed.description: Whether or not the offense has been appealed

appealedOn.description: The date the offense was appealed

arrestedOn.description: The date the subject was arrested

arrestingAgency.description: The agency or organization involved in the arrest

caseStatus.description: The current and overall status of the case

caseStatusDate.description: The date that the case status was last updated

charge.description: With what crime was the subject charged

convictedCharge.description: The final charge with which the subject was convicted

chargedOn.description: The date when the subject was charged

chargeStatus.description: The current and individual status of this specific charge

wasConvicted.description: Whether or not the subject was convicted of this charge

countNum.description: The number identifying which charge in docket

courtRoom.description: The name or number of the court room

disposition.description: The final settlement of the matter with reference to the decision announced by the court

dispositionDate.description: The date the disposition was made

event.description: A description of the proceedings reflected in the docket

filedOn.description: The date on which the charge was filed

financialSummary.description: Any financial settlement that came out of the docket

hearingDate.description: The date on which the hearing occurred

hearingType.description: The type of hearing (e.g. pretrial, jury selection, etc.)

offenseClass.description: The class of the offense (e.g. felony, misdemeanor, etc.)

offenseType.description: The type of wrongdoing or violation of administrative matters, etc.

plea.description: The formal reply to a charge in a criminal court or in an equity case telling why a suit should be barred, delayed, or dismissed

proceedings.description: Details of proceedings (e.g. arraignment, jury trial, sentencing trial)

sentence.description: The punishment given to a person convicted of a crime

sentencedOn.description: The date that the sentence is given

sentenceStatus.description: The current status of the sentence (e.g. released on parole, successfully completed sentence)

chargeCode.description: A charge code under which the subject was charged (e.g. 18-2). This helps research further the nature of the crime.

CivilDocketType.title: CivilDocketType
CivilDocketType.description: Includes properties common to civil court dockets

details.description: Litigation details associated with the Docket

filedOn.description: The date on which the litigation was filed

plaintiff.description: The person who filed the litigation

defendant.description: The party accused of a civil wrong

caseDescription.description: The cause for the civil litigation

dispositionDate.description: The date of the court's finding

sentence.description: The decision or the outcome of the case when additional guidelines need to be met (e.g. restitution owed, lawyer fees owed, etc.)

BankruptcyDocketType.title: BankruptcyDocketType
BankruptcyDocketType.description: Includes properties common to bankruptcy dockets

filedOn.description: The date on which the bankruptcy was filed

natureOfDebt.description: Examples may include Business, Notice of Proposed Abandonment, Voluntary Petition, Non-business Consumer, Unpaid Real Estate Tax, Consumer, Commercial

caseDescription.description: Description of the case as found in the court record

commencement.description: The type of the bankruptcy (e.g. Chapter 13, Chapter 7)

dispositionDate.description: The date of the court's decision

sentence.description: The decision or the outcome of the case when additional guidelines need to be met (e.g. repayment plan, liquidation, adjustment of debts, etc.)

orderId.description: Typically used for a reference ID provided by the Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA) specific to the order itself. Can often be used as a lookup value in the CRA's client portal.

serviceCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening type (e.g. MVR, Criminal, Civil, Credit, Fingerprinting, Education, Employment).

result.description: Overall result of service. Typically would be reflective of a value like Report, Clear, Canceled, NotPursued etc. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

details.description: Contains service results. e.g. an array of CriminalDocketType objects.

attachments.description: This points to the attachments array

path.description: Indicates JSON Pointer value such as /foo/bar. Although this is a string, HR Open requires a json-pointer format. Do not use JSON Pointer URI fragments such as #/foo/bar

description.description: The message text.

value.description: Indicates the value the field should have.

orderId.description: Provides the Identifier of the ScreeningVendorOrder to which this message pertains. Uniquely identifies a ScreeningVendorOrder within an organization.

fields.description: A list of fields that need attention.

attachments.description: List of documents associated with this message

CatalogPackageType.title: CatalogPackageType
CatalogPackageType.description: A list of available screening packages.

packageCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening package.

packageDescription.description: The description of what the screening package.

type.description: Disclosure Types (e.g. Felony, Misdemeanor, Forclosure, Civil Investigation).

agency.description: The entity that handled the Disclosure.

names.description: List of names associated with this person.

addresses.description: List of addresses associated with this subject.

profile.description: Details about this person, such-as work history

traits.description: Traits about this person: SSN, DOB

legal.description: Legal properties about this person: mother's surname

attachments.description: List of documents associated with this person

disclosures.description: The data that represents a Disclosure is typically provided by the Applicant and is often sparse.

orderId.description: Typically used for a reference ID provided by the Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA) specific to the order itself. Can often be used as a lookup value in the CRA's client portal.

statusMessage.description: Overall status of order.  Typically would be reflective of a value like Pending, Complete, etc. Specific to each Consumer Reporting Agency (CRA).

reportLink.description: A link to the background screening report.

ReferenceObjectTypeArray.title: ReferenceObjectTypeArray
ReferenceObjectTypeArray.description: Array of referenceObjects, such as a billing code, job code, division, etc. Values that are assigned and meaningful to an ATS. This should not include Id of the order, which would be handled in NounType Id

CatalogALaCarteType.title: CatalogALaCarteType
CatalogALaCarteType.description: A list of all available ALaCarte items.

screeningCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening type (e.g. MVR, Criminal, Civil, Credit, DrugTesting, Fingerprinting, Education, Employment).

category.description: The category that this screening type falls in.

CourtSearchOptionsType.title: CourtSearchOptionsType
CourtSearchOptionsType.description: A set of court specific search options.

yearSearchEnds.description: Ordinarily not supplied. Used to perform a search on a specific set of years in the past. E.g. a 1996-2000 search, numberOfYearsSearched=5 and yearSearchEnds=2000

isCopyRequiredIndicator.description: Indicates if court copies need to be obtained.

ScreeningVendorOrderSubjectType.title: ScreeningVendorOrderSubjectType
ScreeningVendorOrderSubjectType.description: A set of subject specific properties.

purpose.description: The reason why this subject is supplied (e.g. to search, for adjudication, etc.).

serviceCode.description: The code corresponding to a screening type (e.g. MVR, Criminal, Civil, Credit, Fingerprinting, Education, Employment).

subjects.description: The subjects of the requested service. Supply multiple subjects if the subject may match on multiple descriptions (e.g. they may be found under different Date of Birth values).

purpose.description: The reason why this report is requested (e.g. Court Order/Subpoena, Employment, Insurance Underwriting).

referenceObjects.description: Reference to the data required for the package.

instructions.description: Instructions for what information should be sent for a Lead.

workLocations.description: Work location used for reporting guidelines.

PositionProfileType.title: PositionProfileType
PositionProfileType.description: A profile of a job or position opening that is available at an organization.

profileName.description: The name given to the profile. Often used in systems where multiple versions of a PositionProfile may be managed.

positionPeriod.description: The start and end date for the position.

immediateStartIndicator.description: An indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.

positionScheduleTypeCodes.description: Describes a position's general schedule (e.g. full-time, part-time).

workingPeriods.description: Describes the working periods of the position.

shiftSchedules.description: The detailed specifications of shift schedules.

shiftDescription.description: General description of any shift work or shift schedule.

remoteWork.description: The preference or requirement for remote work.

offeredRemunerationPackage.description: The salary or compensation, as well as benefits on offer for the position.

positionClassification.description: The classification of the position (which may apply to specific countries).

relocation.description: Indicates if a hiring company would consider to support the relocation of a new employee for a position.

attachments.description: Attachments related to the position profile.

BasePositionProfileType.title: BasePositionProfileType
BasePositionProfileType.description: The core information about a job or position opening.

profileId.description: The primary identifier of the position profile, typically from the system of record.

alternateIds.description: An array of other identifiers for the position profile, typically for related, secondary, or other systems.

positionId.description: The identifier for the position that maybe be used externally in an advertisement.

positionTitle.description: A short phrase describing the position as it would be listed on a business card or in a company directory. OED: An appellation attaching to a position in virtue of rank, function or office.

positionUri.description: URI to detailed resources about the position. This can be used as another type of identifier.

postingInstructions.description: Instructions related to the position being posted to a third party site.

positionLocation.description: The location or locations of a position.

name.description: The name of a location.

referenceLocation.description: This is a summary description of the physical location of the position. This is intended to be matched against a candidate's preference for work location.

positionOrganizations.description: The organization which has the position. Can contain multiple organizations, e.g. with different responsibility codes.

positionOpenQuantity.description: The position quantity currently available to be filled. This is intended as a finer-grained expression of the total number of positions to be filled. For example, there may be 50 positions to fill, but only 10 immediately available to be filled.

jobCategories.description: A code classifying the type or category of job. This may be used for occupational classification of the job. JobCategory usually would be repeatable so that a single job could be classified across multiple dimensions. JobCategory could be used to classify the job in terms of industry, but note that an explicit IndustryCode is available in the organization which might be a more appropriate place for use.

careerLevels.description: A code classifying the level of a candidate based on career experience. This may vary by jurisdiction or systems, e.g. Student, Entry Level, Recent Graduate, Mid-Career, Manager, Experienced Non-Manager, Senior Executive, etc.

positionOfferingTypes.description: These are values that are descriptive in classifying a position within advertising or communications of a position opportunity or "offering". Note that these classifications are useful within advertising, but they are not precise classes useful internally to drive pay, benefits, and HR compliance. Enumerated values are: DirectHire, Temporary, TemporaryToHire, ContractToHire, Contract, Internship, Externship, Apprenticeship, Seasonal, Student and Volunteer. Consider that "Temporary" and "DirectHire" are not parallel concepts, but are still commonly used in classifying jobs within advertising.

positionQualifications.description: The qualifications that are required for a position.

positionFormattedDescriptions.description: The descriptions for the position profile. The descriptions may support HTML or other markup, and may be in logical sections.

workingLanguages.description: Information on the work languages used for the job or position opening.

PostingInstructionType.title: PostingInstructionType
PostingInstructionType.description: A collection of information about where and how a posting should be communicated. A posting channel usually would be a job board or other advertising medium.

channelId.description: Identifies a job board or media channel associated with a job posting.

start.description: The start date of the posting.

end.description: The end date of the posting.

templateId.description: Identifies a template to apply in processing a job posting order.

brandingId.description: Identifies branding to be applied in processing a job posting order.

postingOptionCodes.description: Used to communicate a choice among options available with respect to the posting. For example, some job boards and advertising venues may offer "bolding" or other options relating to the display or distribution of the posting.

items.description: Describes the way in which a candidate might apply for the position.

positionUri.description: URI to detailed resources about the position or job advertisement for this posting instruction. The URI may contain publication specific information which may vary by channel.

ApplicationMethodType.title: ApplicationMethodType
ApplicationMethodType.description: Instructions on how to apply for the position.

instructions.description: Instructions to help guide a candidate when they are applying for the position opening.

personContact.description: The person to contact regarding this position.

applicationUri.description: Application link used to apply for the position. This would typically be a URI to a career site job, to an application web form, or an upload page.

applicationEmail.description: Email address to which the candidate can apply to the job or position opening.

applicationSms.description: Phone number to apply for the job or position opening by SMS message.

containedText.description: Text that must be used by the candidate in the SMS message to indicate the intent to apply for a specific position.

applicationPhone.description: Information to apply by a phone based service or direct phone number.

address.description: The address of where to go to apply for the job or position opening in person.

travelDirections.description: Instructions for traveling to the location for an in person application.

mapLink.description: A URI to a map or detailed instructions to do an in person application.

additionalInstructions.description: Additional instructions on how to apply for the job or position opening in person.

end.description: The date after which applications will not be accepted.

typeCode.description: The type of application close date, such as an Internal Close Date or External Close Date.

qualificationSummary.description: A summary of the qualifications needed for the position.

positionCompetencies.description: A list of the competencies required or desired for the position. Used for competency-based recruiting systems for matching.

educationRequirement.description: The educational requirements for the position.

experienceSummary.description: The detailed summary of the experience required for the position in terms of category, measure, and level.

licences.description: The required licenses for the position.

educationLevelCode.description: The level of education required for the position. This is used to transmit a system-specific or local variable. Use iscedEducationLevelCode where possible.

iscedEducationLevelCode.description: ISCED: International Standard Classification of Education - is the standard classification of the education level of this requirement.

degreeTypeCode.description: The type of degree required for the position.

programs.description: The education programs required for a position.

programConcentrations.description: The areas for the focus of study specific areas required for the position.

institutions.description: The requirement or specific institutions to be considered for the position.

descriptions.description: Descriptions of the educational requirements for the position.

categoryCode.description: A code to represent the category of required experience.

measure.description: A measure of the experience required for the position.

levelCode.description: The level required for the category of required experience.

descriptions.description: Description of required experience.

USPositionClassification.description: These are USA-specific position classification items.

DEPositionClassification.description: These are Germany-specific position classification items.

extendedPositionClassifications.description: These are other country specific position classification items.

exemptIndicator.description: An indicator of position's coverage under applicable wage-hour law. For example, the U.S. Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA) and implementing regulations. Enumerated values are: exempt and non-exempt. NOTE: In the U.S., while it is common to classify a position as exempt or non-exempt, actual coverage under the law usually is determined on the basis of an employee's actual performance or engagement within a workweek and not on whether an employee is assigned to or associated with a position that an employer has classified as "exempt" or "nonexempt".

EEOCJobCategoryCodes.description: A code classifying the primary method of payment for the associated position or employment. This classifies the method by which remuneration for a position is provided or calculated. Typical values are 'OfficialsAndManagers', 'Professionals', 'Technicians', 'Sales', 'OfficialAndClerical', 'CraftWorkersSkilled', 'OperativeSemi-Skilled', 'LaborersUnskilled', 'ServiceWorkers'.

affirmativeActionPlanJobGroupIds.description: Identifiers for specific qualifying affirmitive action plan groups.

BKZClassification.description: Berufskennziffer (BKZ) is a German occupational classification system.

disabilityLevelCode.description: A value from an external code list classifying the level of disability. A simple example code list: 1 - need for another persons assistance with daily life tasks; 2 - inability to perform one or more sensory or physical functions; 3 - experiencing difficulties in multiple sensory or physical functions; 4 - experiencing difficulty in just one function; and 5 - no limitations in functioning.

countryCode.description: The country to which the specific position classification applies.

name.description: The name of the specific position classification.

value.description: The value of the specific position classification.

workDuration.description: The amount of time to work, e.g. 40 hours, 4 days.

baseDuration.description: The related base time interval, e.g. 1 week, 1 month.

descriptions.description: Descriptions of the working period.

LER_RSType.title: LER-RSType
LER_RSType.description: Learning and Employment Record Resume Standard

type.description: The instance type to assist implementors of this standard to discover the schema and version of the instance. Recommend using the full URL to the schema and version for LER-RS you are using. Example: http://schema.hropenstandards.org/4.4/recruiting/json/ler-rs/LER-RSType.json

narratives.description: Experiences, Aspirations, Interests (or any free form text elements) of a person.

job.description: The related Job to this LER Resume.

certifications.description: Documents or confirmations certifying the status or acquirements of the bearer, or his fulfillment of conditions which authorize them to act or practise in a specified way; hence, often equal to a certificate.

person.description: Information to identify the person, including name, communication, demographic details and other identifiers.

educationAndLearnings.description: Contains details documenting a person's education and learnings, which typically consists of formal higher education (high school or higher).

employmentHistories.description: The prior and current details of a person's employment, work, or relevant experience such as might be reported within a professional profile, CV, resume, employment application, or similar document. Details of a particular tenure of employment or work with an organization.

licenses.description: Authoritative permission to hold a certain status or to do certain things, e.g. to practise some trade or profession. (OED license, n. a. A formal, usually a printed or written permission from a constituted authority to do something. b. The document embodying such a permission.)

skills.description: Skills are proficiencies and abilities developed through training and experience. Skills are quantifiable and/or measurable. Skills may involve manipulating things, data or people, either verbally, manually or mentally to accomplish an objective. Skills can be developed with practice or appropriate training.

employmentPreferences.description: A list of information about a person's preferences in an ideal employer or company.

positionPreferences.description: A list of information about a person's preferences in an ideal position or role.

communication.description: Allows capture of information about a variety of communication channels (telephone, email, fax, messaging, address, etc.).

attachments.description: Content of an attachments, which can be embedded or an external reference.

JobType.description: The reference to a related job for the Resume. This can be either a JDX Job Description or an HR Open Postion Opening instance.

positionOpening.description: The related HR Open Position Opening.

JobPostingType.title: JobPostingType
JobPostingType.description: Entity describing an on-line advertisement for filling one or more job openings.

abilities.description: Aptitude, capacity or power to act physically, socially, mentally, legally, or morally at a level suitable to the work context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of ability types such as the O*NET cognitive, sensory, psychomotor and physical abilities.

alternativeCredentials.description: Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeEducation.description: Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeExperiences.description: Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

applicantLocationRequirements.description: Geographic location(s) in which employees may be located for remote (telecommuting) jobs.

attitudes.description: Motivator of performance including values, aspirations, and priorities necessary to successful performance of a task or job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of attitude types.

baseSalaries.description: Base salary of the job or of an employee in an employee role including minimum and maximum salary and unit value (e.g., hour, day, week, month, or year).

careerLevels.description: A code classifying the level of a candidate based on career experience; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of career level types (e.g., HR Open Standards CareerLevelCodeList.json).

citizenshipRequirements.description: Required country of the applicant's citizenship. Note(s): Use a value selected from a country code list such as the Library of Congress' List of Countries.

competencies.description: Observable and measurable knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes that contribute to enhanced employee performance of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

dateCreated.description: Date on which the position was created.

dateModified.description: Date on which the position was modified.

datePosted.description: Date of posting by a channel.

disclaimers.description: Statement that denies aspects of a statement made or omitted by the employing entity in the position or posting.

educationLevels.description: Word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of education levels such as HR Open Standards IscedCodeList.json.

employerOverview.description: Description of the employer, career opportunities and work environment.

employmentUnit.description: Department, unit and/or facility where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.

equivalentCredentials.description: Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.

equivalentEducation.description: Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation. Note(s): An educational experience without award of a credential should be recorded with a range of QualifyingExperience. An educational experience with award of a credential should be recoded with a range of Credential, not QualifyingExperience.

equivalentExperiences.description: Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.

estimatedSalaries.description: Description of the estimated salary for a job posting based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location.

experienceCategories.description: Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience types including, but not limited to, "Education Experience", "Training Experience", "Work Experience", "Apprenticeship", and "Traineeship".

formattedDescriptions.description: HTML-tagged summary of the salient aspects of the job, including job responsibilities, qualifications, skills, working hours, education requirements, and experience requirements.

postingInstructions.description: Resource providing instructions for posting a job position opening to a job board or media channel and for submission of applications.

incentiveCompensation.description: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

identifiers.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Note(s): Identifier in JDX has a constrained range of PropertyValue. Best practice is to use name property to textually identify the type of identifier, value property to hold the textual value of the identifier, and the properytID for a URI indicating the type of identifier. NOTE: JDX defines positionID and postingID to handle the employer's identifier for a particular position or posting.

industries.description: Description of the most critical economic or work activities performed (e.g. software development, electronic manufacturing, motor vehicle production, or diagnostic and therapeutic services). Note(s): NOTE: The industry description expected here is a brief narrative of the most critical economic or work activities performed. To identify a formal industry code, such as NAICS in the U.S., use the industryCode property.

industryCodes.description: Code from a controlled vocabulary of industry types identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed. Note(s): 1.) Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union. 2.) In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels and locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations.

inLanguage.description: The language of the content of the job posting.

jobAgreements.description: Type of employment agreement (e.g. "employee", "contract-to-hire", "contract", "internship", "externship", "apprenticeship", "student", "volunteer", "under collective bargaining", "eligible for overtime"; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment contract agreements; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

jobBenefits.description: Description of benefits associated with the job (e.g., "employee discount", "health insurance", "401K plan"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of benefit types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

jobImmediateStart.description: Indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.

jobLocation.description: Typically single geographic location where the work is performed.

jobLocationTypes.description: A description of the job location (e.g., TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).

jobSchedules.description: Schedule of the employment (e.g. "full-time", "part-time", "flex-time", "hourly", "shared-time"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment schedule types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

jobStartDate.description: Target date when the employment would begin.

jobTerms.description: Type of employment term (e.g. "regular", "temporary", "seasonal"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment term types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

knowledge.description: Body of facts, principles, theories and practices that is related to a field of work or study; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of knowledge types such as the O*NET knowledge.

minimumExperiences.description: Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.

minimumCredentials.description: Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.

minimumEducation.description: Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

occupationCategories.description: Category of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC).

physicalActivities.description: Description of the physical activity expected or required for a position. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of physical activity types such as "bending", "standing", "sitting".

positionID.description: Employer's identifier for a particular position.

postingID.description: Employer's identifier for a particular job posting. Note(s): For the identifier of the position for this posting, use positionID.

preferredCredentials.description: Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.

preferredEducation.description: Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.

preferredExperiences.description: Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.

qualificationSummary.description: Summary description of the ideal candidate's qualifications for a position.

reportingRelationships.description: Position(s) to which this position reports and over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.

requiredAssessments.description: Resource referenced is an example of a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.

requiredConditions.description: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.

requiredCredentials.description: Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.

requiredEducation.description: Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation. Note(s): Specific credential requirements should use requiredCredential.

requiredExperiences.description: Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.

responsibilities.description: Key work tasks or activities over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of responsibilities.

riskExposures.description: Description of any exposure to risks associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

securityClearanceRequirements.description: Description of any security clearance requirements.

shiftSchedules.description: Type of the typical work shift of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of work shift types. Sample may include swing shift, day shift, or weekend shift.

skills.description: Ability to apply knowledge and use know-how to complete tasks and solve problems including types or categories of developed proficiency or dexterity in mental operations and physical processes required to fulfill a work role; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of skill types such as the O*NET skills.

specialCommitments.description: Any special commitments associated with this job posting (e.g. low-income, native American, ex-offenders, military commit) along with any special exclusions (e.g. criminal records).

tasks.description: Piece or unit of work to be done or undertaken and accomplished within a defined period of time or by a deadline; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of task types such as O*NET tasks.

technologies.description: Tool, application or other form of technology that requires knowledge, skill and ability to use effectively in executing the tasks and responsibilities of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of technology types such as O*NET technology and tools.

totalJobOpenings.description: Total number of positions open at all locations.

travelRequirements.description: Information about any required travel, systematic or occasional.

validFrom.description: The date from which the job posting is valid.

validThrough.description: The date after which the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

workActivities.description: Purposeful, systematic activity by one or more workers acting on a work objective to reach an intended outcome; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of activity types such as the O*NET work activities.

workLanguages.description: Information on the work languages used for the job.

workHours.description: Typical working hours for this job; e.g. "1st shift", "night shift", "8am-5pm".

PositionOpeningType.title: PositionOpeningType
PositionOpeningType.description: A job or position opening that is at an organization.

statusCode.description: Status of position opening; typical values: Active, Closed, Incomplete.

approvalStatusCode.description: Status of the approval process for a position opening; typical values: InReview, Approved, NotApproved.

approvalMessage.description: Detailed information on the approval process, or reason for the approval status.

approvalProcessHistory.description: Information about the approval process history.

postingRequester.description: Information about the party placing or communicating the position posting. The party requesting the posting or advertising service.

roleCode.description: The role of the party or person making the position posting.

positionProfiles.description: The profile(s) of the position opening. A single position opening could have multiple position profiles for different purposes, including language, branding, or distribution channels or rules.

CandidateType.title: CandidateType
CandidateType.description: A person who is requesting consideration or is being considered for a current or future position at a company.

CandidatePersonType.title: CandidatePersonType
CandidatePersonType.description: A collection of demographic and personal data about a candidate - a person being considered for, or who has otherwise been associated with, a position opening or resource requirement.

CandidateProfileType.title: CandidateProfileType
CandidateProfileType.description: Contains structured information about a candidate, including information about their past experiences (Work History, Education History, etc.). This information can be used for evaluation or submission of candidacy for a position opening or resource requirement.

profileId.description: The primary identifier of the candidate profile. This should be the identifier assigned by the owner of the data.

alternateIds.description: An array of other identifiers for the candidate profile. These may be identifiers assigned by other trading partners or third party systems.

personAvailability.description: The availability of this profile to be considered for work assignments.

processingInformation.description: Instructions to a third party on how this profile should be processed.

distributionGuidelines.description: Instructions to a third party on how this profile should be distributed.

associatedPositionOpenings.description: The positions in which this candidate is associated. This could be due to application or source activities.

objective.description: The objective of the candidate in finding appropriate employment. A brief statement on career and position goals.

executiveSummary.description: A concise section describing the experience of the candidate, or an introduction to the candidate.

employerPreferences.description: A list of information about a candidate's preferences in an ideal employer or company.

positionPreferences.description: A list of information about a candidate's preferences in an ideal position or role.

candidateRelationships.description: A list of information about a candidate's relationship to the (potential) employer.

candidateSources.description: A list of information about a candidate's sources.

applicationProcessHistory.description: Information about the application process history.

workLifeCycles.description: Information to specify details on the recruiting life cycle. For example, application date, hire date, rejection date including rejection reason, etc.

PersonAvailabilityType.title: PersonAvailabilityType
PersonAvailabilityType.description: Details about when a person is available for work engagements.

noticePeriodMeasure.description: The notice period that is required.

immediateStartIndicator.description: An indicator that the person could start immediately.

AvailabilityDatesType.title: AvailabilityDatesType
AvailabilityDatesType.description: The dates of availability for work engagements.

DistributionGuidelinesType.title: DistributionGuidelinesType
DistributionGuidelinesType.description: The rules for dispersing information contained in the object to a person or organization.

doNotRedistributeIndicator.description: An indicator to not redistribute this to other third parties.

DistributionType.title: DistributionType
DistributionType.description: The person or organization to which objects should (not) be distributed, and the related effective dates.

DistributeToType.title: DistributeToType
DistributeToType.description: The person or organization to which the objects should be delivered, and the effective dates of this distribution.

DoNotDistributeToType.title: DoNotDistributeToType
DoNotDistributeToType.description: The person or organization to which the objects should not be delivered (excluded), including the effective dates to this exclusion.

AssociatedPositionOpeningType.title: AssociatedPositionOpeningType
AssociatedPositionOpeningType.description: Contains details answering the questions: 1. What, if any, are the position openings with which is the candidate associated? 2. How did the candidate become associated with those positions? The positionOpeningId, positionTitle, and positionUri components address the first question. The candidateAppliedIndicator addresses the second question. All elements are optional. In general, a candidate becomes associated with a position by applying to be considered for the position or by having been sourced and matched to the opening through some manner of automated and/or human-initiated recruiting or research process.

positionOpeningId.description: An identifier to a related position opening (related to recruiting for a job).

staffingOrderId.description: An identifier to a related staffing order (related to filling a position from a staffing organization).

positionTitle.description: A short phrase describing the position as it would be listed on a business card or in a company directory. OED: An appellation attaching to a position in virtue of rank, function or office.

positionUri.description: A Uniform Resource Identifier to the associated position opening. This is often a web page or HTTP URL.

candidateAppliedIndicator.description: An indicator that the candidate applied to this associated position.

dispositionStatus.description: The current disposition status of the candidate to the associated position opening.

DispositionStatusType.title: DispositionStatusType
DispositionStatusType.description: Contains the related disposition or status of a candidate related to a specific position opening.

name.description: The name of the disposition status.

code.description: The code of the disposition status.

description.description: Description of the disposition status.

reasonCode.description: A reason code representing the reason for the disposition change.

reasonDescription.description: Description of the reason for the status code change. Typically used for the rejection reason or hire reason.

date.description: The date of the disposition change.

CandidateRelationshipType.title: CandidateRelationshipType
CandidateRelationshipType.description: Information about the relationship of a candidate to the (potential) employer of his/her candidacy.

candidateRelationshipId.description: An identifier for the relationship of a candidate to a (potential) employer, e.g. current or former employee number.

internalCandidateIndicator.description: An indicator to classify the candidate as internal to the (potential) employer. This could be a current employee, current intern, or current contractor.

candidateRelationshipCode.description: A code classifying the relationship of a candidate to a (potential) employer.

otherCandidateRelationshipCode.description: Further information characterizing the relationship of a candidate to a (potential) employer. Mostly vendor or employer specific.

CandidateSourceType.title: CandidateSourceType
CandidateSourceType.description: Information about the source of a candidate.

type.description: Information on the type of source.

order.description: Information on the order of source.

uri.description: A URI (uniform resource identifier) to more information on the candidate on the internet. This could include a public profile URL, an online resume, or a person website.

distributionGuidelines.description: Instructions on how this candidate should be distributed to third parties.

person.description: Information to identify the person, including name, communication, demographic details and other identifiers.

profiles.description: Information on the profiles of a candidate. A typical candidate will have one profile, but additional profiles can be included in difference languages, presentations, or industry focus.

ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialLER_RSTyp.title: ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialLER-RSType
ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialLER_RSTyp.description: LER-RS Provisional JSON Schema for W3C Verifiable Credential

@context.description: An ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1. The set must contain a URI with the value http://schema.hropenstandards.org/4.5RC/recruiting/json/ler-rs/ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEducationAndLearningType.json. Subsequent items in the array express context information.

id.description: Identifier for the only subject of the credential.

items.description: The @context property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1.
Context for ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialLER-RSType.

rdfs:comment.@value: A person who is requesting consideration or is being considered for a current or future position at a company.
hrrec:CandidateType;Instructions on how this candidate should be distributed to third parties.
hrrec:LER-RSType,hrrec:CandidateType;Information to identify the person, including name, communication, demographic details and other identifiers.

hrrec:CandidateType;Information on the profiles of a candidate. A typical candidate will have one profile, but additional profiles can be included in difference languages, presentations, or industry focus.
hrrec:CandidateType;A URI (uniform resource identifier) to more information on the candidate on the internet. This could include a public profile URL, an online resume, or a person website.
Entity describing an on-line advertisement for filling one or more job openings.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation. Note(s): Specific credential requirements should use requiredCredential.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;

hrrec:JobPostingType;Motivator of performance including values, aspirations, and priorities necessary to successful performance of a task or job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of attitude types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Position(s) to which this position reports and over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of benefits associated with the job (e.g., "employee discount", "health insurance", "401K plan"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of benefit types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobPostingType;The date from which the job posting is valid.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Aptitude, capacity or power to act physically, socially, mentally, legally, or morally at a level suitable to the work context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of ability types such as the O*NET cognitive, sensory, psychomotor and physical abilities.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Ability to apply knowledge and use know-how to complete tasks and solve problems including types or categories of developed proficiency or dexterity in mental operations and physical processes required to fulfill a work role; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of skill types such as the O*NET skills.

hrrec:LER-RSType;Skills are proficiencies and abilities developed through training and experience. Skills are quantifiable and/or measurable. Skills may involve manipulating things, data or people, either verbally, manually or mentally to accomplish an objective. Skills can be developed with practice or appropriate training.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Any special commitments associated with this job posting (e.g. low-income, native American, ex-offenders, military commit) along with any special exclusions (e.g. criminal records).
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Key work tasks or activities over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of responsibilities.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the physical activity expected or required for a position. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of physical activity types such as "bending", "standing", "sitting".

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation. Note(s): An educational experience without award of a credential should be recorded with a range of QualifyingExperience. An educational experience with award of a credential should be recoded with a range of Credential, not QualifyingExperience.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the employer, career opportunities and work environment.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Piece or unit of work to be done or undertaken and accomplished within a defined period of time or by a deadline; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of task types such as O*NET tasks.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Body of facts, principles, theories and practices that is related to a field of work or study; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of knowledge types such as the O*NET knowledge.
hrrec:JobPostingType;HTML-tagged summary of the salient aspects of the job, including job responsibilities, qualifications, skills, working hours, education requirements, and experience requirements.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Resource providing instructions for posting a job position opening to a job board or media channel and for submission of applications.
hrrec:JobPostingType;The date after which the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Target date when the employment would begin.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Type of the typical work shift of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of work shift types. Sample may include swing shift, day shift, or weekend shift.
hrrec:PositionProfileType;The detailed specifications of shift schedules.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;In detail specification of shift schedules.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;The language of the content of the job posting.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Summary description of the ideal candidate's qualifications for a position.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the estimated salary for a job posting based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Tool, application or other form of technology that requires knowledge, skill and ability to use effectively in executing the tasks and responsibilities of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of technology types such as O*NET technology and tools.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Employer's identifier for a particular job posting. Note(s): For the identifier of the position for this posting, use positionID.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Department, unit and/or facility where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Resource referenced is an example of a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Typical working hours for this job; e.g. "1st shift", "night shift", "8am-5pm".
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Code from a controlled vocabulary of industry types identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed. Note(s): 1.) Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union. 2.) In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels and locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations.
hrrec:EmployerPreferenceType;A list of industry codes which are preferred to the candidate.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Schedule of the employment (e.g. "full-time", "part-time", "flex-time", "hourly", "shared-time"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment schedule types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;The title of the job.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Type of employment term (e.g. "regular", "temporary", "seasonal"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment term types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Statement that denies aspects of a statement made or omitted by the employing entity in the position or posting.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Date on which the position was created.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Employer's identifier for a particular position.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Purposeful, systematic activity by one or more workers acting on a work objective to reach an intended outcome; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of activity types such as the O*NET work activities.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Date of posting by a channel.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Total number of positions open at all locations.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Geographic location(s) in which employees may be located for remote (telecommuting) jobs.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Type of employment agreement (e.g. "employee", "contract-to-hire", "contract", "internship", "externship", "apprenticeship", "student", "volunteer", "under collective bargaining", "eligible for overtime"; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment contract agreements; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Information on the work languages used for the job.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Agent requesting the posting.
hrrec:JobPostingType;Base salary of the job or of an employee in an employee role including minimum and maximum salary and unit value (e.g., hour, day, week, month, or year).

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Note(s): Identifier in JDX has a constrained range of PropertyValue. Best practice is to use name property to textually identify the type of identifier, value property to hold the textual value of the identifier, and the properytID for a URI indicating the type of identifier. NOTE: JDX defines positionID and postingID to handle the employer's identifier for a particular position or posting.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Information about any required travel, systematic or occasional.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;A description of the job location (e.g., TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Observable and measurable knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes that contribute to enhanced employee performance of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Date on which the position was modified.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.

hrrec:JobPostingType;A code classifying the level of a candidate based on career experience; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of career level types (e.g., HR Open Standards CareerLevelCodeList.json).

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of any exposure to risks associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types. hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Organization offering the job position.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Typically single geographic location where the work is performed.

hrrec:JobPostingType;Category of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC).

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of the most critical economic or work activities performed (e.g. software development, electronic manufacturing, motor vehicle production, or diagnostic and therapeutic services). Note(s): NOTE: The industry description expected here is a brief narrative of the most critical economic or work activities performed. To identify a formal industry code, such as NAICS in the U.S., use the industryCode property.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Required country of the applicant's citizenship. Note(s): Use a value selected from a country code list such as the Library of Congress' List of Countries.
hrrec:JobDescriptionType,hrrec:JobPostingType;Description of any security clearance requirements.
Learning and Employment Record Resume Standard
hrrec:LER-RSType;A list of information about a person's preferences in an ideal employer or company.
hrrec:LER-RSType;Experiences, Aspirations, Interests (or any free form text elements) of a person.
hrrec:LER-RSType;Content of an attachments, which can be embedded or an external reference.
hrrec:PositionProfileType;Attachments related to the position profile.
hrrec:LER-RSType;Contains details documenting a person's education and learnings, which typically consists of formal higher education (high school or higher).

hrrec:LER-RSType;The instance type to assist implementors of this standard to discover the schema and version of the instance. Recommend using the full URL to the schema and version for LER-RS you are using. Example: http://schema.hropenstandards.org/4.4/recruiting/json/ler-rs/LER-RSType.json

hrrec:LER-RSType;Documents or confirmations certifying the status or acquirements of the bearer, or his fulfillment of conditions which authorize them to act or practise in a specified way; hence, often equal to a certificate.

hrrec:LER-RSType;Authoritative permission to hold a certain status or to do certain things, e.g. to practise some trade or profession. (OED license, n. a. A formal, usually a printed or written permission from a constituted authority to do something. b. The document embodying such a permission.)
hrrec:LER-RSType;A list of information about a person's preferences in an ideal position or role.

hrrec:LER-RSType;The prior and current details of a person's employment, work, or relevant experience such as might be reported within a professional profile, CV, resume, employment application, or similar document. Details of a particular tenure of employment or work with an organization.
hrrec:LER-RSType;The related Job to this LER Resume.
hrrec:LER-RSType;Allows capture of information about a variety of communication channels (telephone, email, fax, messaging, address, etc.).

hrrec:PositionProfileType;The start and end date for the position.

hrrec:PositionProfileType;Indicates if a hiring company would consider to support the relocation of a new employee for a position.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;Indicates if a candidate would consider moving to a new city or location for a suitable position.
hrrec:PositionProfileType;General description of any shift work or shift schedule.
hrrec:PositionProfileType;Describes the working periods of the position.

hrrec:EmployerPreferenceType;A list of organization names which are preferred to the candidate.
hrrec:EmployerPreferenceType;A list of text descriptions of the candidate preferences for an employer.
hrrec:RelocationType;Text describing any special considerations about relocation.
hrrec:TravelType;Text describing any special travel preferences or considerations.
