hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A job grade code for the position. This would be defined by a company, union, or industry.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A list of shifts which are preferred to the candidate.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A list of career levels which are preferred to the candidate. This describes the experience level, management level, or other levels of measuring a career.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A list of position titles which are preferred to the candidate.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A list of job categories which are preferred to the candidate.

hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A code classifying the language or languages used within the workplace or associated with work. This is intended to communicate general information about the language(s) used within the work environment or correspondingly general information about a candidate's specific language preferences. This component might be offered as descriptive 'pre-qualification' information on a position announcement. It might appear within the context of a Candidate Profile as a general statement of a candidate's general language capabilities or preferences. WorkingLanguageCode is not intended as a statement of language proficiency or specific requirement relating to language proficiency. Specific information regarding language proficiency should be covered either within PersonCompetency or PositionCompetency as may be appropriate.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;A list of locations which are preferred to the candidate.

hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;These are values that are descriptive in classifying a position within advertising or communications of a position opportunity or offering. Note that these classifications are useful within advertising, but they are not precise classes useful internally to drive pay, benefits, and HR compliance. This is an enumerated list.
hrrec:PositionPreferenceType;Information regarding travel preferences of a person seeking a job.
Information about relocation.
hrrec:RelocationType;Indicates whether relocation is an option for the candidate or considered by the hiring company.
Represents the remote work specification.
hrrec:RemoteWorkType;The details related to the RestrictionCode that help to describe the specifics of the remote work restriction.
hrrec:RemoteWorkType;A list of codes defining work locations allowed for or desired for remote work.
hrrec:RemoteWorkType;A list of codes defining the scope of restrictions of work locations allowed for or desired for remote work.
hrrec:RemoteWorkType;Indicator for remote work is available to employee.
hrrec:RemoteWorkType;The requirements of the remote work for a candidate. This could include having a computer, internet access, a quiet or private office environment, etc.
Information regarding travel - preferences or necessities.
hrrec:TravelType;Indicates that a person is willing to travel within the capacity of his or her position.
hrrec:TravelType;The percentage of time required (or willing) to travel for a position. For example, a person needs (or is willing) to travel 25% of his or her regularly scheduled hours.

Entity providing a statement of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.

JobDescriptionType.title: JobDescriptionType
JobDescriptionType.description: Entity providing a statement of a job position generally including the formal job title, duties, purpose, responsibilities, scope, reporting relationships and working conditions along with the knowledge, skills, abilities, education, qualifications, experience and other requirements for performing the job.

alternativeCredentials.description: Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeEducation.description: Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeExperiences.description: Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

citizenshipRequirements.description: Required country of the applicant's citizenship. Note(s): Use a value selected from a country code list such as the Library of Congress' List of Countries.

competencies.description: Observable and measurable knowledge, skills, abilities and personal attributes that contribute to enhanced employee performance of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

dateCreated.description: Date on which the position was created.

dateModified.description: Date on which the position was modified.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

disclaimers.description: Statement that denies aspects of a statement made or omitted by the employing entity in the position or posting.

educationLevels.description: Word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of education levels such as HR Open Standards IscedCodeList.json.

employmentUnit.description: Department, unit and/or facility where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.

equivalentCredentials.description: Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.

equivalentEducation.description: Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation. Note(s): An educational experience without award of a credential should be recorded with a range of QualifyingExperience. An educational experience with award of a credential should be recoded with a range of Credential, not QualifyingExperience.

equivalentExperiences.description: Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.

experienceCategories.description: Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience types including, but not limited to, "Education Experience", "Training Experience", "Work Experience", "Apprenticeship", and "Traineeship".

incentiveCompensation.description: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

identifiers.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Note(s): Identifier in JDX has a constrained range of PropertyValue. Best practice is to use name property to textually identify the type of identifier, value property to hold the textual value of the identifier, and the properytID for a URI indicating the type of identifier. NOTE: JDX defines positionID and postingID to handle the employer's identifier for a particular position or posting.

industries.description: Description of the most critical economic or work activities performed (e.g. software development, electronic manufacturing, motor vehicle production, or diagnostic and therapeutic services). Note(s): NOTE: The industry description expected here is a brief narrative of the most critical economic or work activities performed. To identify a formal industry code, such as NAICS in the U.S., use the industryCode property.

industryCodes.description: Code from a controlled vocabulary of industry types identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed. Note(s): 1.) Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union. 2.) In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels and locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations.

inLanguage.description: The language of the content of the job posting.

jobAgreements.description: Type of employment agreement (e.g. "employee", "contract-to-hire", "contract", "internship", "externship", "apprenticeship", "student", "volunteer", "under collective bargaining", "eligible for overtime"; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment contract agreements; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

jobLocation.description: Typically single geographic location where the work is performed.

jobLocationTypes.description: A description of the job location (e.g., TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).

jobTerms.description: Type of employment term (e.g. "regular", "temporary", "seasonal"); select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of employment term types; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

knowledge.description: Body of facts, principles, theories and practices that is related to a field of work or study; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of knowledge types such as the O*NET knowledge.

minimumExperiences.description: Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.

minimumCredentials.description: Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.

minimumEducation.description: Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

physicalActivities.description: Description of the physical activity expected or required for a position. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of physical activity types such as "bending", "standing", "sitting".

positionID.description: Employer's identifier for a particular position.

preferredCredentials.description: Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.

preferredEducation.description: Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.

preferredExperiences.description: Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.

qualificationSummary.description: Summary description of the ideal candidate's qualifications for a position.

reportingRelationships.description: Position(s) to which this position reports and over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership.

requiredAssessments.description: Resource referenced is an example of a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.

requiredConditions.description: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.

requiredCredentials.description: Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.

requiredEducation.description: Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation. Note(s): Specific credential requirements should use requiredCredential.

requiredExperiences.description: Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.

responsibilities.description: Key work tasks or activities over which this position exercises some degree of authority, control or leadership. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of responsibilities.

riskExposures.description: Description of any exposure to risks associated with the job including exposure to extreme noise or temperature, dust/particle matter, radiation, chemicals, airborne communicable diseases and bloodborne pathogens.

securityClearanceRequirements.description: Description of any security clearance requirements.

skills.description: Ability to apply knowledge and use know-how to complete tasks and solve problems including types or categories of developed proficiency or dexterity in mental operations and physical processes required to fulfill a work role; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of skill types such as the O*NET skills.

tasks.description: Piece or unit of work to be done or undertaken and accomplished within a defined period of time or by a deadline; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of task types such as O*NET tasks.

technologies.description: Tool, application or other form of technology that requires knowledge, skill and ability to use effectively in executing the tasks and responsibilities of the job; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of technology types such as O*NET technology and tools.

travelRequirements.description: Information about any required travel, systematic or occasional.

workActivities.description: Purposeful, systematic activity by one or more workers acting on a work objective to reach an intended outcome; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of activity types such as the O*NET work activities.

workLanguages.description: Information on the work languages used for the job.

workHours.description: Typical working hours for this job; e.g. "1st shift", "night shift", "8am-5pm".

JDXOrganizationType.title: JDXOrganizationType
JDXOrganizationType.description: An organization such as a corporate body, employer, distribution channel provider.

contactPoint.description: A contact point for a person or organization.

department.description: Relationship between an organization and a department of that organization.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

duns.description: Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

email.description: Email address of an organization or person.

faxNumber.description: Fax number of an organization or person.

fein.description: Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) identifying organizations, persons, states, government agencies, corporations, and companies.

geo.description: The geo coordinates of the place.

job.description: Entity referenced is a full description of a job defined and to be offered by the organization being described.

industries.description: Description of the most critical economic or work activities performed (e.g. software development, electronic manufacturing, motor vehicle production, or diagnostic and therapeutic services). Note(s): NOTE: The industry description expected here is a brief narrative of the most critical economic or work activities performed. To identify a formal industry code, such as NAICS in the U.S., use the industryCode property.

industryCodes.description: Code from a controlled vocabulary of industry types identifying the primary economic activity of an establishment defined as a single physical location where business is conducted or where services or industrial operations are performed. Note(s): 1.) Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of industry types used in the country where the job is located; e.g., NAICS in the U.S. and ESCO in the European Union. 2.) In a JDX job description, there my be multiple levels and locations for an organization identified and each may have different industry codes based on the kinds of work performed at those locations.

isicV4.description: International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

jobLocation.description: Typically single geographic location where the work is performed.

legalName.description: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

leiCode.description: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

naics.description: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

numberOfEmployees.description: Number of employees in the hiring organization.

parentOrganization.description: The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of, if any.

sameAs.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

subOrganization.description: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary.

telephone.description: The telephone number of an organization or person.

ConditionType.title: ConditionType
ConditionType.description: Entity providing the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.

alternativeCondition.description: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions about alternative conditions.

alternativeCredentials.description: Description of an alternative credential fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeEducation.description: Description of an alternative education or training fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

alternativeExperiences.description: Description of an alternative experience fulfilling requirements for the position or occupation.

equivalentCredentials.description: Description of an equivalent credential for the position or occupation.

equivalentEducation.description: Description of equivalent education or training for the position or occupation. Note(s): An educational experience without award of a credential should be recorded with a range of QualifyingExperience. An educational experience with award of a credential should be recoded with a range of Credential, not QualifyingExperience.

equivalentExperiences.description: Description of equivalent experience for the position or occupation.

minimumExperiences.description: Description of the minimum experience needed for the position or occupation.

minimumCredentials.description: Description of the minimum credential needed for the position or occupation.

minimumEducation.description: Description of the minimum education needed for the position or occupation.

preferredCondition.description: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical asserions about alternative conditions.

preferredCredentials.description: Description of the preferred credential needed for the position or occupation.

preferredEducation.description: Description of the preferred education or training needed for the position or occupation.

preferredExperiences.description: Description of the preferred experience needed for the position or occupation.

requiredConditions.description: Resource referenced provides the means to make logical assertions that combine resources that in aggregate fulfill education, experience and credential requirements.

requiredCredentials.description: Description of the required credential needed for the position or occupation.

requiredEducation.description: Description of the required education or training needed for the position or occupation. Note(s): Specific credential requirements should use requiredCredential.

requiredExperiences.description: Description of the required experience needed for the position or occupation.

faxNumber.description: Fax number of an organization or person.

geo.description: The geo coordinates of the place.

jobOpeningNumber.description: Number of positions open at this location.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

telephone.description: The telephone number of an organization or person.

QuantitativeValueType.title: QuantitativeValueType
QuantitativeValueType.description: Point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

maxValue.description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

minValue.description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

unitText.description: Unit of measurement on which values for MonetaryAmount or QuantitativeValue are based; select from an existing enumeration of such types. An example of MonetaryAmount is $100 per day where unitText equals DAY.

value.description: Value of the quantitative value or property value node.

PostingInstructionsType.title: PostingInstructionsType
PostingInstructionsType.description: Entity providing information about where and how a posting should be communicated. Note(s): A posting channel usually would be a job board or other advertising medium (HR).

applicationContact.description: Organization or person contact point for the posting.

applicationInstructions.description: Narrative instructions for applying for this position.

applicationLocation.description: Physical location where job applications can be submitted.

distributionChannel.description: Identifies a job board or media channel associated with a job posting.

addressCountry.description: The relevant country of the resource. For example, USA.

addressLocality.description: The locality; e.g., Mountain View, London, Moscow.

addressRegion.description: The region; e.g., CA, TX. Note(s): The relevant state, province, territory or other subdivision of a nation.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

streetAddress.description: Street address; for example, "1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy".

DefinedTermSetType.title: DefinedTermSetType
DefinedTermSetType.description: A set of defined terms for example a set of categories or a classification scheme, a glossary, dictionary or enumeration.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

AssessmentProfileType.title: AssessmentProfileType
AssessmentProfileType.description: Entity that describes the key characteristics of an assessment administered to candidates for a job.

areaAssessed.description: Description of the area or domain to be assessed.

assessmentMethod.description: Type of method used to conduct an assessment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of assessment method types such as the AssessmentMethod vocabulary.

conceptKeyword.description: Word or phrase used to refine and describe significant aspects of the entity.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

evidenceCategory.description: The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types.

QualifyingExperienceType.title: QualifyingExperienceType
QualifyingExperienceType.description: Entity describing verifiable work, education or training experience supporting a person's qualification to perform the tasks and responsibilities of a position. Note(s): A QualifyingExperience that results in the award of some form of credential should use the Credential class to describe that award.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

duration.description: Duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

educationLevels.description: Word or phrase identifying the location of the person in terms of his or her progression through an education or training context; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of education levels such as HR Open Standards IscedCodeList.json.

evidence.description: Referenced artifact or performance confirming or supporting an assertion.

evidenceCategory.description: The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types.

experienceCategories.description: Category of experience needed for the position or Occupation; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience types including, but not limited to, "Education Experience", "Training Experience", "Work Experience", "Apprenticeship", and "Traineeship".

inLanguage.description: The language of the content of the job posting.

levelCode.description: Level of experience required; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of experience level types such as the HR Open CareerLevelCodeList.json.

occupationCategories.description: Category of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC).

programConcentration.description: Focused plan of study within a college or university degree such as a concentration in Aerospace Engineering within an Engineering degree.

provider.description: Agent that provides, publishes, owns or otherwise has the authority to make the resource being described available.

MonetaryAmountType.title: MonetaryAmountType
MonetaryAmountType.description: A monetary value or range. Note(s): This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between 1,000 and 1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

maxValue.description: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

minValue.description: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

payCycleInterval.description: Pay cycle interval specifies how often the pay cycle occurs or, in other words, how often a person is paid, e.g., "daily", "weekly", "monthly", "yearly" etc.; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of pay cycles (e.g., the HR Open PayCycleIntervalCodeList).

unitText.description: Unit of measurement on which values for MonetaryAmount or QuantitativeValue are based; select from an existing enumeration of such types. An example of MonetaryAmount is $100 per day where unitText equals DAY.

value.description: Value of the quantitative value or property value node.

AnnotatedDefinedTermType.title: AnnotatedDefinedTermType
AnnotatedDefinedTermType.description: Word, name, acronym, phrase, defined in a controlled value space (e.g., taxonomy, glossary, dictionary, tag list, and other forms of enumeration). Note(s): Used in the context of JDX to assign terms from occupation, industry and instructional program classifications, skills and abilities, and abstract concepts to JDX entities. Through the class' relationship with the ScaledAnnotation class, terms can be conditioned through applications of scales for attributes such as importance and frequency.

annotation.description: Entity providing qualifying notations including application of scales and other weights to concepts and competencies.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

inDefinedTermSet.description: A defined term set that contains this term.

name.description: The name of the item. Note(s): NOTE: For the name of the hiring organization, use the subproperty legalName.

termCode.description: A code that identifies this DefinedTerm within a DefinedTermSet.

CredentialType.title: CredentialType
CredentialType.description: Entity describing authoritative permission to hold a certain status or to do certain things, e.g. to practice some trade or profession.

credentialCategory.description: Type of credential such as badge, certification, bachelor degree; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of credential types (e.g., credential subclasses from CTDL).

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

duration.description: Duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

evidence.description: Referenced artifact or performance confirming or supporting an assertion.

evidenceCategory.description: The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types.

occupationCategories.description: Category of the relevant occupation of the job used in the country of employment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of occupation categories such as the Standard Occupational Classification (SOC).

programConcentration.description: Focused plan of study within a college or university degree such as a concentration in Aerospace Engineering within an Engineering degree.

provider.description: Agent that provides, publishes, owns or otherwise has the authority to make the resource being described available.

ScaleAnnotationType.title: ScaleAnnotationType
ScaleAnnotationType.description: Resource for identifying and applying a defined scale or rating to another resource. Note(s): Used, for example, when applying an importance scale to a competency identified in an instance of the AnnotatedDefinedTerm class.

acquiredInternally.description: Whether or not a requirement in a posting may be acquired post-hire.

acquisitionDifficulty.description: Rating or score representing the difficulty of the particular entity to acquire. Note(s): The scale may be applied to any appropriate controlled vocabulary concept such as knowledge, skill, and ability as identified in the associated AnnotationDefinedTerm.

assessmentMethod.description: Type of method used to conduct an assessment; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of assessment method types such as the AssessmentMethod vocabulary.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

evidenceCategory.description: The type of referenced artifact, exam or performance confirming or supporting an assertion; select from an existing enumeration of such types. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of evidence types.

preferred.description: Whether or not the attribute being annotated has been given priority.

required.description: Whether or not the attribute being annotated is required.

requiredAssessments.description: Resource referenced is an example of a direct, indirect, formative, and summative evaluation or estimation of the nature, ability, or quality of a person's performance or outcome of an action.

requiredAtHiring.description: Whether or not a particular requirement is expected at the time of hiring or may be subsequently obtained.

scaleCategory.description: Type or category of scale or weighting to be applied to a specific competency (knowledge, skill, ability), task, responsibility, interest etc.; select from an existing enumeration of such types.

PropertyValueType.title: PropertyValueType
PropertyValueType.description: Property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of an entity. Note(s): Use PropertyValue sparingly! Always use a specific property from a known namespace when they serve your purpose. Using PropertyValue as a substitute for such properties will not trigger the same linked data function as the predicate of an RDF triple as will a more specific property.

propertyID.description: URL indicating the type of the property and pointing to an external vocabulary.

value.description: Value of the quantitative value or property value node.

ContactPointType.title: ContactPointType
ContactPointType.description: Contact pointfor example, for information about a job opening or interview.

contactType.description: Specification of the type of contact point. Note(s): Use a value selected from a controlled vocabulary of contact types.

descriptions.description: A description of the item. Note(s): Some online job boards and other services (e.g., Google Jobs) require the general description of a JobPosting to be HTML tagged; in such instances, use the formattedDescription property (if available) instead of the description property.

email.description: Email address of an organization or person.

faxNumber.description: Fax number of an organization or person.

ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEmploymen.title: ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEmploymentHistoryType
ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEmploymen.description: Provisional Employment Histories JSON Schema for W3C Verifiable Credential

The set must contain a URI with the value http://schema.hropenstandards.org/4.5RC/recruiting/json/ler-rs/ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEmploymentHistoryType.json. Subsequent items in the array express context information.

credentialSubject.description: HROpen Employment Histories claims about the subjects of the credential.

id.description: Identifier for the only subject of the credential.

items.description: The @context property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1.
Context for ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialEmploymentHistoryType.

name.description: Name of the skill.

yearsOfExperience.description: The number of years of experience using the skill.

description.description: Simple description of the skill.

definitionReference.description: Reference (and scheme) to more formal information about the skill than a simple description.

schemeReference.description: Reference and scheme of the skill.

interestLevel.description: A rating of a person's interest. The interest level is expressed as a score, a point scale, or a mark among range of values.

org.description: A verifiable Certification with information from a verifying organization. Note that this is not a Verifiable Credential (VC).

ref.description: A external reference to a verification of the Certification. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

prov.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type HR Open Certification.

1edtob3.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type Open Badge v3, as defined by 1EdTech ( https://www.imsglobal.org/activity/openbadges ).

other.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of any type.

VerifyingOrganizationType.title: VerifyingOrganizationType
VerifyingOrganizationType.description: A reference to an organization that can provide verification of a claim (by contacting the organization and/or person identified).

verifyingOrganization.description: An organization that can provide verification of a claim (by contacting the organization and/or person identified).

credentialSubject.description: HROpen Education Attendance claims about the subjects of the credential.

org.description: A verifiable employment history with information from a verifying organization. Note that this is not a Verifiable Credential (VC).

ref.description: A external reference to a verification of the employment history. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

prov.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type HR Open EmploymentHitory.

other.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of any type.

ref.description: A external reference to a verification of the education attendance. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

scheme.description: A URI (uniform resource identifier) of the reference scheme.

ResumePersonBaseType.title: ResumePersonBaseType
ResumePersonBaseType.description: Represents common data about a person for a ResumeCV.

legalId.description: The legal identifier of a person. The issuer is most likely a country or state.

birthDate.description: The birth date of a person.

citizenship.description: The citizenships that a person holds. This is a legal citizenship in a country (as opposed to nationality which may or may not be a country).

residenceCountry.description: The country (or countries) where a person currently resides.

militaryStatus.description: The military status of a person.

ethnicity.description: The ethnicity (or ethnicities) of a person. Ethnicity is an ethnic group or a social group that shares a common and distinctive culture, religion, and/or language.

primaryLanguage.description: This list is based on Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) RFC 4646 and RFC 4647 for language tags. This tag system is extensible to region, dialect, and private designations. The IANA Language Subtag Registry is a source of the tag values. See http://www.iana.org/assignments/language-subtag-registry

name.description: Data comprising a person's name.

ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialDataModel.title: ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialDataModelBaseType
ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialDataModel.description: Base Provisional JSON Schema based on Verifiable Credentials Data Model v1.1 - https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/

id.description: The id property is intended to unambiguously refer to an object, such as a person, product, or organization. Using the id property allows for the expression of statements about specific things in the verifiable credential. The value of the id property MUST be a URI.

type.description: The value of the type property MUST be, or map to (through interpretation of the @context property), one or more URIs. If more than one URI is provided, the URIs MUST be interpreted as an unordered set.

issuer.description: The entity that issued the credential. The value of the issuer property MUST be either a URI or an object containing an id property.

expirationDate.description: When the credential ceases to be valid.

credentialSchema.description: MUST be one or more data schemas that provide verifiers with enough information to determine if the provided data conforms to the provided schema.

credentialStatus.description: Information about the current status of a verifiable credential, such as whether it is suspended or revoked.

id.description: MUST be a URI of the issuer credential status method.

type.description: Provides enough information to determine the current status of the credential.

refreshService.description: MUST be one or more data schemas that provide verifiers with enough information to determine if the provided data conforms to the provided schema.

evidence.description: MUST be one or more evidence schemes providing enough information for a verifier to determine whether the evidence gathered by the issuer meets its confidence requirements for relying on the credential.

termsOfUse.description: MUST specify one or more terms of use policies under which the creator issued the credential.

proof.description: One or more cryptographic proofs that can be used to detect tampering and verify the authorship of a credential.

ProofType.description: Digital proof that makes the credential tamper-evident.

type.description: The cryptographic signature suite that was used to generate the signature.

created.description: The date the signature was created.

verificationMethod.description: The identifier of the public key that can verify the signature.

challenge.description: Challenge and domain protect against replay attacks.

domain.description: Challenge and domain protect against replay attacks.

RefreshServiceType.description: Each refreshService value MUST specify its type (for example, ManualRefreshService2018) and its id, which is the URI of the service.

CredentialSchemaType.description: The Type and id URI of identifying the schema.

EvidenceType.description: Each evidence scheme is identified by its type. The id property is optional, but if present, SHOULD contain a URL that points to where more information about this instance of evidence can be found. The precise content of each evidence scheme is determined by the specific evidence type definition.

TermsOfUseType.description: Each termsOfUse value MUST specify its type, for example, IssuerPolicy, and MAY specify its instance id. The precise contents of each term of use is determined by the specific termsOfUse type definition.

org.description: A verifiable education attendance with information from a verifying organization. Note that this is not a Verifiable Credential (VC).

ref.description: A external reference to a verification of the education attendance. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

prov.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type HR Open EducationAndLearning.

1edtob3.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type Open Badge v3, as defined by 1EdTech ( https://www.imsglobal.org/activity/openbadges ).

1edtclr2.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type Comprehensive Learner Record v2, as defined by 1EdTech ( https://www.imsglobal.org/activity/comprehensive-learner-record ).

other.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of any type.

org.description: A verification with information from a verifying organization. Note that this is not a Verifiable Credential (VC).

ref.description: A external reference to a verification. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

other.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of any type.

NameValueType.description: Classic Name-Value. Cane beused as a keyword where only the name is present.

name.description: The name.

value.description: The value.

ref.description: A external reference to a verification of the License. Note that this may or may not be a reference to a Verifiable Credential (VC).

prov.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type HR Open License.

1edtob3.description: A Verifiable Credential (VC) of the type Open Badge v3, as defined by 1EdTech ( https://www.imsglobal.org/activity/openbadges ).

NarrativeType.title: NarrativeType
NarrativeType.description: A named set of texts, which may have a reference to the definition of the narrative and keywords.

name.description: The name for the narrative.

definitionReference.description: Reference (and scheme) to more information on the narrative.

EndorserType.title: EndorserType
EndorserType.description: An Endorser, which can be an individual and/or an organization, as defined in https://github.com/WebOfTrustInfo/rwot11-the-hague/blob/master/advance-readings/endorsements.md

person.description: The person who is making an endorsement.

organization.description: The organization that is making an endorsement.

comments.description: Comments related to the endorsement being made by the endorser.

otherW3CVerifiableCredential.description: A W3C Verifiable Credential (VC). This required property is unconstained.

The set must contain a URI with the value http://schema.hropenstandards.org/4.5RC/recruiting/json/ler-rs/ProvisionalVerifiableCredentialCertificationType.json. Subsequent items in the array express context information.

credentialSubject.description: HROpen Certification claims about the subjects of the credential.

id.description: Identifier for the only subject of the credential.

TravelType.title: TravelType
TravelType.description: Information regarding travel - preferences or necessities.

willingToTravelIndicator.description: Indicates that a person is willing to travel within the capacity of his or her position.

percentage.description: The percentage of time required (or willing) to travel for a position. For example, a person needs (or is willing) to travel 25% of his or her regularly scheduled hours.

descriptions.description: Text describing any special travel preferences or considerations.

remoteWorkIndicator.description: Indicator for remote work is available to employee.

workLocationCodes.description: A list of codes defining work locations allowed for or desired for remote work.

restrictionCodes.description: A list of codes defining the scope of restrictions of work locations allowed for or desired for remote work.

remoteEligibilityRequirement.description: The requirements of the remote work for a candidate. This could include having a computer, internet access, a quiet or private office environment, etc.

restrictionDetails.description: The details related to the RestrictionCode that help to describe the specifics of the remote work restriction.

WorkLocationCodeList.title: WorkLocationCodeList
WorkLocationCodeList.description: A code classifying the role of an entity or the role with which that entity is associated. 'Home' allows for work at a candidate's home. 'Virtual' allows for work in any location that is not provided by the company (i.e. airport, coffee shop). 'Colocation' would be for remote office or shared office environment near the candidate.

RestrictionCodeList.title: RestrictionCodeList
RestrictionCodeList.description: A code classifying the restriction of the remote work to a particular region or time zone. 'Local' typically refers to a city or small area. 'Regional' refers to a state, province or official territory. 'Timezone' refers to a restriction based on time zone. 'Country' refers to a restriction in one or more countries. 'Territory' refers to a defined area by the company. 'Other' means a restriction not defined by the other choices. If there are no restrictions, use 'None'. The details of the restriction should be specified in 'RestrictionDetails'.

PositionPreferenceType.title: PositionPreferenceType
PositionPreferenceType.description: Contains a collection of information about a candidate's preferences in an ideal position or role.

locations.description: A list of locations which are preferred to the candidate.

jobCategories.description: A list of job categories which are preferred to the candidate.

positionTitles.description: A list of position titles which are preferred to the candidate.

positionOfferingTypeCodes.description: These are values that are descriptive in classifying a position within advertising or communications of a position opportunity or offering. Note that these classifications are useful within advertising, but they are not precise classes useful internally to drive pay, benefits, and HR compliance. This is an enumerated list.

positionScheduleTypeCodes.description: Values that classify the working schedule of a position offered or a position sought. Essentially, whether a position offered or sought is full-time or part-time or has provision for flexible scheduling. Intended to classify schedule position preferences of a candidate or conversely employer preferences or requirements related to candidates with respect to an advertised position. Used in the context of matching candidates to positions. This is an enumerated list.

shiftSchedules.description: In detail specification of shift schedules.

shiftDescriptions.description: A list of shifts which are preferred to the candidate.

remoteWork.description: The preference for remote work requirement.

careerLevelCodes.description: A list of career levels which are preferred to the candidate. This describes the experience level, management level, or other levels of measuring a career.

jobGradeCode.description: A job grade code for the position. This would be defined by a company, union, or industry.

offeredRemunerationPackage.description: The preference for remuneration (including salary or hourly rate, benefits) for a position.

travel.description: Information regarding travel preferences of a person seeking a job.

relocation.description: Indicates if a candidate would consider moving to a new city or location for a suitable position.

workingLanguageCodes.description: A code classifying the language or languages used within the workplace or associated with work. This is intended to communicate general information about the language(s) used within the work environment or correspondingly general information about a candidate's specific language preferences. This component might be offered as descriptive 'pre-qualification' information on a position announcement. It might appear within the context of a Candidate Profile as a general statement of a candidate's general language capabilities or preferences. WorkingLanguageCode is not intended as a statement of language proficiency or specific requirement relating to language proficiency. Specific information regarding language proficiency should be covered either within PersonCompetency or PositionCompetency as may be appropriate.

PreferredLocationType.title: PreferredLocationType
PreferredLocationType.description: Contains a collection of information about a candidate's preferences in the location of a position.

willingToRelocateIndicator.description: Indicates whether relocation is an option for the candidate or considered by the hiring company.

descriptions.description: Text describing any special considerations about relocation.

EmployerPreferenceType.title: EmployerPreferenceType
EmployerPreferenceType.description: Contains a collection of information about a candidate's preferences in an ideal employer or company.

organizationNames.description: A list of organization names which are preferred to the candidate.

organizationTypes.description: A list of organization types (such as public, non-profit) which are preferred to the candidate.

industryCodes.description: A list of industry codes which are preferred to the candidate.

headcountRange.description: A measure of size of a company based on the number of employees (headcount). This range is inclusive of the minimum and maximum number.

descriptions.description: A list of text descriptions of the candidate preferences for an employer.

RecruitingDocumentStatusCodeList.title: RecruitingDocumentStatusCodeList
RecruitingDocumentStatusCodeList.description: Values that describe the disposition of a position opening document.

CandidateRelationshipCodeList.title: CandidateRelationshipCodeList
CandidateRelationshipCodeList.description: Values that classify the relationship of a candidate to a (potential) employer.

ApprovalStatusCodeList.title: ApprovalStatusCodeList
ApprovalStatusCodeList.description: Values that describe the status of an approval process.

PostingRequesterRoleCodeList.title: PostingRequesterRoleCodeList
PostingRequesterRoleCodeList.description: Values that describe the roles of job posting requesters.

JSON_Schema_for_the_AchievementCredentia.title: JSON Schema for the AchievementCredential class. *************CHANGED TO DRAFT4. Removed dateOfBirth format = date - not supported in Draft4 *************
JSON_Schema_for_the_AchievementCredentia.description: AchievementCredentials are representations of an awarded achievement, used to share information about a achievement belonging to one earner. Maps to a Verifiable Credential as defined in the [[VC-DATA-MODEL]]. As described in [[[#proofs-signatures]]], at least one proof mechanism, and the details necessary to evaluate that proof, MUST be expressed for a credential to be a verifiable credential. In the case of an embedded proof, the credential MUST append the proof in the `proof` property.

items.description: The value of the `@context` property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value 'https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1', and the second item is a URI with the value 'https://purl.imsglobal.org/spec/ob/v3p0/context/ob_v3p0.jsonld'.
items.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

id.description: Unambiguous reference to the credential.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'AchievementCredential' or the URI 'OpenBadgeCredential'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'AchievementCredential' or the URI 'OpenBadgeCredential'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

name.description: The name of the credential for display purposes in wallets. For example, in a list of credentials and in detail views.

description.description: The short description of the credential for display purposes in wallets.

items.description: Allows endorsers to make specific claims about the credential, and the achievement and profiles in the credential. These endorsements are signed with the VC-JWT proof format.
items.$comment: Origin: CompactJws (DerivedType); A `String` in Compact JWS format [[RFC7515]].

issuanceDate.description: Timestamp of when the credential was awarded.
issuanceDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

expirationDate.description: If the credential has some notion of expiry, this indicates a timestamp when a credential should no longer be considered valid. After this time, the credential should be considered expired.
expirationDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

CredentialStatus.description: The information in CredentialStatus is used to discover information about the current status of a verifiable credential, such as whether it is suspended or revoked.

id.description: The value MUST be the URL of the issuer's credential status method.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

type.description: The name of the credential status method.
type.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

AchievementSubject.description: A collection of information about the recipient of an achievement. Maps to Credential Subject in [[VC-DATA-MODEL]].

id.description: An identifier for the Credential Subject. Either `id` or at least one `identifier` MUST be supplied.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'AchievementSubject'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'AchievementSubject'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

activityEndDate.$comment: Origin: DateTime (PrimitiveType); An [[ISO8601]] time using the syntax YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

activityStartDate.$comment: Origin: DateTime (PrimitiveType); An [[ISO8601]] time using the syntax YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.

creditsEarned.description: The number of credits earned, generally in semester or quarter credit hours. This field correlates with the Achievement `creditsAvailable` field.

licenseNumber.description: The license number that was issued with this credential.

narrative.description: A narrative that connects multiple pieces of evidence. Likely only present at this location if evidence is a multi-value array.
narrative.$comment: Origin: Markdown (DerivedType); A `String` that may contain Markdown.

role.description: Role, position, or title of the learner when demonstrating or performing the achievement or evidence of learning being asserted. Examples include 'Student President', 'Intern', 'Captain', etc.

term.description: The academic term in which this assertion was achieved.

IdentityObject.description: A collection of information about the recipient of an achievement.

type.description: MUST be the IRI 'IdentityObject'.
type.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

hashed.description: Whether or not the `identityHash` value is hashed.
hashed.$comment: Origin: Boolean (PrimitiveType); A boolean, expressed as `true` or `false`

identityHash.description: Either the IdentityHash of the identity or the plaintext value. If it's possible that the plaintext transmission and storage of the identity value would leak personally identifiable information where there is an expectation of privacy, it is strongly recommended that an IdentityHash be used.
identityHash.$comment: Origin: IdentityHash (DerivedType); A hash string containing an algorithm identifier and a resulting hash of an identifier, separated by a dollar sign ('$') and the algorithm used to generate the hash. The only supported algorithms are MD5 [[RFC1321]] and SHA-256 [[FIPS-180-4]], identified by the strings md5 and sha256 respectively. Resulting hash for each of these algorithms MUST be expressed in hexadecimal using uppercase (A-F, 0-9) or lowercase character (a-f, 0-9) sets. For example: sha256$7a1a1b3f7d40552e4299180e346e3add12bf9a751a43d9c4ca4518febc2c60c6 represents the result of calculating a SHA-256 hash on the string 'mayze'.

salt.description: If the `identityHash` is hashed, this should contain the string used to salt the hash. If this value is not provided, it should be assumed that the hash was not salted.

Evidence.description: Descriptive metadata about evidence related to the achievement assertion. Each instance of the evidence class present in an assertion corresponds to one entity, though a single entry can describe a set of items collectively. There may be multiple evidence entries referenced from an assertion. The narrative property is also in scope of the assertion class to provide an overall description of the achievement related to the assertion in rich text. It is used here to provide a narrative of achievement of the specific entity described. If both the description and narrative properties are present, displayers can assume the narrative value goes into more detail and is not simply a recapitulation of description.

id.description: The URL of a webpage presenting evidence of achievement or the evidence encoded as a Data URI. The schema of the webpage is undefined.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Evidence'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Evidence'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

narrative.description: A narrative that describes the evidence and process of achievement that led to an assertion.
narrative.$comment: Origin: Markdown (DerivedType); A `String` that may contain Markdown.

name.description: A descriptive title of the evidence.

description.description: A longer description of the evidence.

genre.description: A string that describes the type of evidence. For example, Poetry, Prose, Film.

audience.description: A description of the intended audience for a piece of evidence.

EndorsementCredential.description: A verifiable credential that asserts a claim about an entity. As described in [[[#proofs-signatures]]], at least one proof mechanism, and the details necessary to evaluate that proof, MUST be expressed for a credential to be a verifiable credential. In the case of an embedded proof, the credential MUST append the proof in the `proof` property.

items.description: The value of the `@context` property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value 'https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1', and the second item is a URI with the value 'https://purl.imsglobal.org/spec/ob/v3p0/context/ob_v3p0.jsonld'.
items.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementCredential'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementCredential'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

id.description: Unambiguous reference to the credential.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

issuanceDate.description: Timestamp of when the credential was awarded.
issuanceDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

expirationDate.description: If the credential has some notion of expiry, this indicates a timestamp when a credential should no longer be considered valid. After this time, the credential should be considered expired.
expirationDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

Achievement.description: A collection of information about the accomplishment recognized by the Assertion. Many assertions may be created corresponding to one Achievement.

id.description: Unique URI for the Achievement.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: No description supplied.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: No description supplied.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

achievementType.description: The type of achievement. This is an extensible vocabulary.
achievementType.$comment: Origin: AchievementType (EnumExt); The type of achievement, for example 'Award' or 'Certification'. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary. Extending the vocabulary makes use of a naming convention.

creditsAvailable.description: Credit hours associated with this entity, or credit hours possible. For example 3.0.

description.description: A short description of the achievement.

items.description: Allows endorsers to make specific claims about the Achievement. These endorsements are signed with the VC-JWT proof format.
items.$comment: Origin: CompactJws (DerivedType); A `String` in Compact JWS format [[RFC7515]].

fieldOfStudy.description: Category, subject, area of study, discipline, or general branch of knowledge. Examples include Business, Education, Psychology, and Technology.

humanCode.description: The code, generally human readable, associated with an achievement.

name.description: The name of the achievement.

specialization.description: Name given to the focus, concentration, or specific area of study defined in the achievement. Examples include 'Entrepreneurship', 'Technical Communication', and 'Finance'.

items.description: Tags that describes the type of achievement.
items.$comment: Origin: String (PrimitiveType); Character strings.

version.description: The version property allows issuers to set a version string for an Achievement. This is particularly useful when replacing a previous version with an update.

Alignment.description: Describes an alignment between an achievement and a node in an educational framework.

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Alignment'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Alignment'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

targetCode.description: If applicable, a locally unique string identifier that identifies the alignment target within its framework and/or targetUrl.

targetDescription.description: Short description of the alignment target.

targetFramework.description: Name of the framework the alignment target.

targetType.description: The type of the alignment target node.
targetType.$comment: Origin: AlignmentTargetType (EnumExt); The type of the alignment target node in the target framework.

targetUrl.description: URL linking to the official description of the alignment target, for example an individual standard within an educational framework.

Criteria.description: Descriptive metadata about the achievements necessary to be recognized with an assertion of a particular achievement. This data is added to the Achievement class so that it may be rendered when the achievement assertion is displayed, instead of simply a link to human-readable criteria external to the achievement. Embedding criteria allows either enhancement of an external criteria page or increased portability and ease of use by allowing issuers to skip hosting the formerly-required external criteria page altogether. Criteria is used to allow would-be recipients to learn what is required of them to be recognized with an assertion of a particular achievement. It is also used after the assertion is awarded to a recipient to let those inspecting earned achievements know the general requirements that the recipients met in order to earn it.

id.description: The URI of a webpage that describes in a human-readable format the criteria for the achievement.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

narrative.description: A narrative of what is needed to earn the achievement. Markdown is allowed.
narrative.$comment: Origin: Markdown (DerivedType); A `String` that may contain Markdown.

type.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'IdentifierEntry'.
type.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

identifier.$comment: Origin: Identifier (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that functions as an identifier.

type.description: Signature suite used to produce proof.

challenge.description: A value chosen by the verifier to mitigate authentication proof replay attacks.

domain.description: The domain of the proof to restrict its use to a particular target.

nonce.description: A value chosen by the creator of proof to randomize proof values for privacy purposes.

proofPurpose.description: The purpose of the proof to be used with `verificationMethod`. MUST be 'assertionMethod'.

verificationMethod.description: The URL of the public key that can verify the signature.
verificationMethod.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

resultDescription.description: An achievement can have many result descriptions describing possible results. The value of `resultDescription` is the `id` of the result description linked to this result. The linked result description must be in the achievement that is being asserted.

value.description: A string representing the result of the performance, or demonstration, of the achievement. For example, 'A' if the recipient received an A grade in class.

items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: An ordered list of allowed values. The values should be ordered from low to high as determined by the achievement creator.

name.description: The name of the result.

requiredValue.description: A value from `allowedValue` or within the range of `valueMin` to `valueMax` required to pass as determined by the achievement creator.

resultType.description: The type of result this description represents. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary.
resultType.$comment: Origin: ResultType (EnumExt); The type of result. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary. Extending the vocabulary makes use of a naming convention.

valueMax.description: The maximum possible `value` that may be asserted in a linked result.

valueMin.description: The minimum possible `value` that may be asserted in a linked result.

Profile.description: A Profile is a collection of information that describes the entity or organization using Open Badges. Issuers must be represented as Profiles, and recipients, endorsers, or other entities may also be represented using this vocabulary. Each Profile that represents an Issuer may be referenced in many BadgeClasses that it has defined. Anyone can create and host an Issuer file to start issuing Open Badges. Issuers may also serve as recipients of Open Badges, often identified within an Assertion by specific properties, like their url or contact email address.

id.description: Unique URI for the Issuer/Profile file.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Profile'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Profile'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

name.description: The name of the entity or organization.

url.description: The homepage or social media profile of the entity, whether individual or institutional. Should be a URL/URI Accessible via HTTP.
url.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

phone.$comment: Origin: PhoneNumber (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` representing a phone number.

description.description: A short description of the issuer entity or organization.

items.description: Allows endorsers to make specific claims about the individual or organization represented by this profile. These endorsements are signed with the VC-JWT proof format.
items.$comment: Origin: CompactJws (DerivedType); A `String` in Compact JWS format [[RFC7515]].

email.$comment: Origin: EmailAddress (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` representing an email address.

official.description: If the entity is an organization, `official` is the name of an authorized official of the organization.

familyName.description: Family name. In the western world, often referred to as the 'last name' of a person.

givenName.description: Given name. In the western world, often referred to as the 'first name' of a person.

additionalName.description: Additional name. Includes what is often referred to as 'middle name' in the western world.

honorificPrefix.description: Honorific prefix(es) preceding a person's name (e.g. 'Dr', 'Mrs' or 'Mr').

honorificSuffix.description: Honorific suffix(es) following a person's name (e.g. 'M.D, PhD').

familyNamePrefix.description: Family name prefix. As used in some locales, this is the leading part of a family name (e.g. 'de' in the name 'de Boer').

dateOfBirth.$comment: Origin: Date (PrimitiveType); An [[ISO8601]] calendar date using the syntax YYYY-MM-DD.

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Address'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

streetAddress.description: A street address within the locality.

postOfficeBoxNumber.description: A post office box number for PO box addresses.

GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a location.

JSON_Schema_for_the_ClrCredential_class_.description: A ClrCredential is a CLR with all the properties needed to conform with a Verifiable Credential as defined in the [[VC-DATA-MODEL]].  *************CHANGED TO DRAFT4. Removed date format = date - not supported in Draft4 *************

description.description: Optional description of the CLR. May be displayed by wallet user interfaces.

partial.description: True if CLR does not contain all the assertions known by the publisher for the learner at the time the CLR is issued. Useful if you are sending a small set of achievements in real time when they are achieved. If False or omitted, the CLR SHOULD be interpreted as containing all the assertions for the learner known by the publisher at the time of issue.
partial.$comment: Origin: Boolean (PrimitiveType); A boolean, expressed as `true` or `false`

expirationDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`
