hashed.description: Whether or not the `identityHash` value is hashed.
hashed.$comment: Origin: Boolean (PrimitiveType); A boolean, expressed as `true` or `false`

identityHash.description: Either the IdentityHash of the identity or the plaintext value. If it's possible that the plaintext transmission and storage of the identity value would leak personally identifiable information where there is an expectation of privacy, it is strongly recommended that an IdentityHash be used.
identityHash.$comment: Origin: IdentityHash (DerivedType); A hash string containing an algorithm identifier and a resulting hash of an identifier, separated by a dollar sign ('$') and the algorithm used to generate the hash. The only supported algorithms are MD5 [[RFC1321]] and SHA-256 [[FIPS-180-4]], identified by the strings md5 and sha256 respectively. Resulting hash for each of these algorithms MUST be expressed in hexadecimal using uppercase (A-F, 0-9) or lowercase character (a-f, 0-9) sets. For example: sha256$7a1a1b3f7d40552e4299180e346e3add12bf9a751a43d9c4ca4518febc2c60c6 represents the result of calculating a SHA-256 hash on the string 'mayze'.

salt.description: If the `identityHash` is hashed, this should contain the string used to salt the hash. If this value is not provided, it should be assumed that the hash was not salted.

VerifiableCredential.description: A Verifiable Credential as defined in the [[VC-DATA-MODEL]]. As described in [[[#proofs-signatures]]], at least one proof mechanism, and the details necessary to evaluate that proof, MUST be expressed for a credential to be a verifiable credential. In the case of an embedded proof, the credential MUST append the proof in the `proof` property.

items.description: The value of the `@context` property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value 'https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1'.
items.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

targetId.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: No description supplied.

items.description: No description supplied.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

achievementType.description: The type of achievement. This is an extensible vocabulary.
achievementType.$comment: Origin: AchievementType (EnumExt); The type of achievement, for example 'Award' or 'Certification'. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary. Extending the vocabulary makes use of a naming convention.

creditsAvailable.description: Credit hours associated with this entity, or credit hours possible. For example 3.0.

description.description: A short description of the achievement.

items.description: Allows endorsers to make specific claims about the Achievement. These endorsements are signed with the VC-JWT proof format.

fieldOfStudy.description: Category, subject, area of study, discipline, or general branch of knowledge. Examples include Business, Education, Psychology, and Technology.

humanCode.description: The code, generally human readable, associated with an achievement.

name.description: The name of the achievement.

specialization.description: Name given to the focus, concentration, or specific area of study defined in the achievement. Examples include 'Entrepreneurship', 'Technical Communication', and 'Finance'.

items.description: Tags that describes the type of achievement.
items.$comment: Origin: String (PrimitiveType); Character strings.

version.description: The version property allows issuers to set a version string for an Achievement. This is particularly useful when replacing a previous version with an update.

Criteria.description: Descriptive metadata about the achievements necessary to be recognized with an assertion of a particular achievement. This data is added to the Achievement class so that it may be rendered when the achievement assertion is displayed, instead of simply a link to human-readable criteria external to the achievement. Embedding criteria allows either enhancement of an external criteria page or increased portability and ease of use by allowing issuers to skip hosting the formerly-required external criteria page altogether. Criteria is used to allow would-be recipients to learn what is required of them to be recognized with an assertion of a particular achievement. It is also used after the assertion is awarded to a recipient to let those inspecting earned achievements know the general requirements that the recipients met in order to earn it.

id.description: The URI of a webpage that describes in a human-readable format the criteria for the achievement.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

narrative.description: A narrative of what is needed to earn the achievement. Markdown is allowed.
narrative.$comment: Origin: Markdown (DerivedType); A `String` that may contain Markdown.

id.description: The unique URI for this result description. Required so a result can link to this result description.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'ResultDescription'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'ResultDescription'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: An ordered list of allowed values. The values should be ordered from low to high as determined by the achievement creator.
items.$comment: Origin: String (PrimitiveType); Character strings.

name.description: The name of the result.

requiredLevel.description: The `id` of the rubric criterion level required to pass as determined by the achievement creator.
requiredLevel.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

requiredValue.description: A value from `allowedValue` or within the range of `valueMin` to `valueMax` required to pass as determined by the achievement creator.

resultType.description: The type of result this description represents. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary.
resultType.$comment: Origin: ResultType (EnumExt); The type of result. This is an extensible enumerated vocabulary. Extending the vocabulary makes use of a naming convention.

valueMax.description: The maximum possible `value` that may be asserted in a linked result.

valueMin.description: The minimum possible `value` that may be asserted in a linked result.

id.description: The unique URI for this rubric criterion level. Required so a result can link to this rubric criterion level.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'RubricCriterionLevel'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'RubricCriterionLevel'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

description.description: Description of the rubric criterion level.

level.description: The rubric performance level in terms of success.

name.description: The name of the rubric criterion level.

points.description: The points associated with this rubric criterion level.

Profile.description: A Profile is a collection of information that describes the entity or organization using Open Badges. Issuers must be represented as Profiles, and recipients, endorsers, or other entities may also be represented using this vocabulary. Each Profile that represents an Issuer may be referenced in many BadgeClasses that it has defined. Anyone can create and host an Issuer file to start issuing Open Badges. Issuers may also serve as recipients of Open Badges, often identified within an Assertion by specific properties, like their url or contact email address.

id.description: Unique URI for the Issuer/Profile file.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Profile'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Profile'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

name.description: The name of the entity or organization.

url.description: The homepage or social media profile of the entity, whether individual or institutional. Should be a URL/URI Accessible via HTTP.
url.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

phone.$comment: Origin: PhoneNumber (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` representing a phone number.

description.description: A short description of the issuer entity or organization.

items.description: Allows endorsers to make specific claims about the individual or organization represented by this profile. These endorsements are signed with the VC-JWT proof format.
items.$comment: Origin: CompactJws (DerivedType); A `String` in Compact JWS format [[RFC7515]].

email.$comment: Origin: EmailAddress (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` representing an email address.

official.description: If the entity is an organization, `official` is the name of an authorized official of the organization.

familyName.description: Family name. In the western world, often referred to as the 'last name' of a person.

givenName.description: Given name. In the western world, often referred to as the 'first name' of a person.

additionalName.description: Additional name. Includes what is often referred to as 'middle name' in the western world.

honorificPrefix.description: Honorific prefix(es) preceding a person's name (e.g. 'Dr', 'Mrs' or 'Mr').

honorificSuffix.description: Honorific suffix(es) following a person's name (e.g. 'M.D, PhD').

familyNamePrefix.description: Family name prefix. As used in some locales, this is the leading part of a family name (e.g. 'de' in the name 'de Boer').

dateOfBirth.$comment: Origin: Date (PrimitiveType); An [[ISO8601]] calendar date using the syntax YYYY-MM-DD.

id.description: The related achievement.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

@language.description: The language of the related achievement.

version.description: The version of the related achievement.

Address.description: An address for the described entity.

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Address'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Address'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

addressCountryCode.description: A country code. The value must be a ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code [[ISO3166-1]].
addressCountryCode.$comment: Origin: CountryCode (DerivedType); A two-digit ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code [[ISO3166-1]].

streetAddress.description: A street address within the locality.

postOfficeBoxNumber.description: A post office box number for PO box addresses.

GeoCoordinates.description: The geographic coordinates of a location.

type.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'GeoCoordinates'.
type.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

EndorsementCredential.description: A verifiable credential that asserts a claim about an entity. As described in [[[#proofs-signatures]]], at least one proof mechanism, and the details necessary to evaluate that proof, MUST be expressed for a credential to be a verifiable credential. In the case of an embedded proof, the credential MUST append the proof in the `proof` property.

items.description: The value of the `@context` property MUST be an ordered set where the first item is a URI with the value 'https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials/v1', and the second item is a URI with the value 'https://purl.imsglobal.org/spec/ob/v3p0/context/ob_v3p0.jsonld'.
items.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementCredential'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementCredential'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

id.description: Unambiguous reference to the credential.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

issuanceDate.description: Timestamp of when the credential was awarded.
issuanceDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

expirationDate.description: If the credential has some notion of expiry, this indicates a timestamp when a credential should no longer be considered valid. After this time, the credential should be considered expired.
expirationDate.$comment: Origin: DateTimeZ (DerivedType); A `DateTime` with the trailing timezone specifier included, e.g. `2021-09-07T02:09:59+02:00`

EndorsementSubject.description: A collection of information about the subject of the endorsement.

id.description: The identifier of the individual, entity, organization, assertion, or achievement that is endorsed.
id.$comment: Origin: URI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that respresents a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementSubject'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the URI 'VerifiableCredential', and one of the items MUST be the URI 'EndorsementSubject'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

endorsementComment.description: Allows endorsers to make a simple claim in writing about the entity.
endorsementComment.$comment: Origin: Markdown (DerivedType); A `String` that may contain Markdown.

Alignment.description: Describes an alignment between an achievement and a node in an educational framework.

oneOf.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Alignment'.
oneOf.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

items.description: The value of the type property MUST be an unordered set. One of the items MUST be the IRI 'Alignment'.
items.$comment: Origin: IRI (DerivedType); A `NormalizedString` that represents an Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI), which extends the ASCII characters subset of the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI).

targetCode.description: If applicable, a locally unique string identifier that identifies the alignment target within its framework and/or targetUrl.

targetDescription.description: Short description of the alignment target.

targetFramework.description: Name of the framework the alignment target.

targetType.description: The type of the alignment target node.
targetType.$comment: Origin: AlignmentTargetType (EnumExt); The type of the alignment target node in the target framework.

targetUrl.description: URL linking to the official description of the alignment target, for example an individual standard within an educational framework.
targetUrl.$comment: Origin: URL (DerivedType); A `URI` that represents a Uniform Resource Locator (URL).

WorkerPaidHoursType.title: WorkerPaidHoursType
WorkerPaidHoursType.description: The hours a worker was paid for time off or actual time worked.

PaidForWorkInPayPeriodType.title: PaidForWorkInPayPeriodType
PaidForWorkInPayPeriodType.description: Details on if the worker was paid in a particular month.

includedDayOfMonth.description: Specifies pay period that includes this day, i.e The person worked during this pay period that includes the 12th.

paidForWorkIndicator.description: Indicate if worker was paid in PayPeriodMonthDay and ReportedYearMonth.

WorkedHoursType.title: WorkedHoursType
WorkedHoursType.description: Specifies the hours worked for a specific pay type. For example, 8 hours of holiday pay.

workedPayTypeCode.description: Type of compensation, e.g. holiday, overtime, shift differential, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the pay type.

workedHours.description: Number of hours worked for a specific pay type.

TimeOffHoursType.title: TimeOffHoursType
TimeOffHoursType.description: The hours a worker took off. For example, 8 hours of vacation pay.

timeOffTypeCode.description: The type of hours a worker took off, such as bereavement, jury duty, vacation, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the pay type.

timeOffHours.description: Number of hours a worker took off.

workerId.description: Provides a unique identifier to a specific worker (an employer specific identifier).

reportingTimePeriod.description: Defines the period of the hours paid and worked. 'As of date' would use the validTo date.

totalPaidHours.description: The total number of hours for which a worker received pay. Includes all actual work hours and hours of employer-paid leave that were used.

totalWorkedHours.description: The total number of hours a worker was engaged in a paid work activity, including regular and premium hours (overtime, shift differential), rest periods and stand-by time. Includes work hours for which compensatory time off was earned. Does not include any employer-paid leave time used.

totalPremiumWorkedHours.description: The number of premium hours a worker actually worked, including stand-by time, for which a premium rate of compensation was paid. Includes overtime and hours for which shift differentials were paid such as night, holiday or weekend work. Includes hours for which compensatory time off was earned, if more than one hour of CTO was earned for each hour of actual work. Does not include any hours used of employer-paid leave time.

totalPaidTimeOffHours.description: The total number of hours of employer-paid time used by a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, meals, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes hours of compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

totalHolidayPaidTimeOffHours.description: When the employer offers such benefit as a separate accrued leave, the number of hours a worker was paid by the employer for absence from work on days of special religious, cultural, social, or patriotic significance, on which work and business ordinarily cease. Includes public and floating holiday paid leave.

workedWeeks.description: The number of weeks during which the worker earned, at a minimum, an amount of remuneration specified by the state based on time worked and paid leave taken.

paidForWorkInPayPeriod.description: Details on if the worker was paid in a particular month.

regularWorkedHours.description: The number of hours a worker was engaged in a regular paid work activity.

premiumWorkedHours.description: The number of hours a worker was engaged in a premium paid work activity, including premium hours (overtime, shift differential), rest periods and stand-by time. Includes work hours for which compensatory time off was earned. Does not include any employer-paid leave time used.

paidTimeOffHours.description: The number of hours of employer-paid time used by a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, meals, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes hours of compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

WorkerWithholdingType.title: WorkerWithholdingType
WorkerWithholdingType.description: Amounts withheld from the worker including taxes, premiums, insurance, other withholdings.

totalTaxWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to taxes.

totalInsurancePremiumsWithholdingAmount.description: The total monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to insurance premiums.

totalRetirementWithholdingAmount.description: The total monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to retirement.

totalOtherWithholdingAmount.description: The total of all other monetary amounts withheld by the employer from the worker's pay for other than taxes, insurance and retirement.

taxWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to taxes.

insurancePremiumsWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to insurance premiums.

retirementWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay to cover the worker's contribution to retirement.

otherWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay for other than taxes, insurance, and retirement.

WorkerCompensationType.title: WorkerCompensationType
WorkerCompensationType.description: The direct and indirect compensation a worker was paid.

workerId.description: Provides a unique identifier to a specific worker (an employer specific identifier).

reportingTimePeriod.description: Defines the period of the compensation paid. 'As of date' would use the validTo date.

totalCompensationAmount.description: The total monetary amount of all cash, cash-equivalent and non-cash compensation that was paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services, for work or time off from work. Includes payments directly to the worker as well as the dollar value of non-cash fringe benefits paid indirectly to the worker.

totalDirectCompensationAmount.description: The total monetary amount of all forms of cash or cash-equivalent compensation paid by the employer directly to the employee for her or his services, for work or time off from work.

totalIndirectCompensationAmount.description: The total monetary value of all compensation and contributions paid by the employer for the workers legally required and discretionary (voluntary) non-cash fringe benefits.

totalWorkerWithholdingAmount.description: The total monetary amount withheld by the employer from the worker's pay for all purposes.

directCompensationAmount.description: The monetary compensation paid to a worker.

indirectCompensationAmount.description: The monetary value of compensation paid by the employer for a worker's voluntary and non-voluntary non-cash fringe benefits.

taxableCompensationAmount.description: The monetary value withheld from the worker for tax purposes.

workerWithholdingAmount.description: The monetary value withheld from the worker for the specified tax, premiums, retirement or other purposes.

GarnishmentInstructionType.title: GarnishmentInstructionType
GarnishmentInstructionType.description: This defines the deduction associated to a garnishment in the context of that which is relevant to payroll processing.

partialGarnishmentAllowedIndicator.description: True: If there isn't enough pay to cover the full garnishment, deduct part of the garnishment.

issuanceDate.description: The date the garnishment was issued.

registrationDate.description: The date the garnishment was registered.

jurisdictionRegions.description: A set of information broadly describing the region(s) where the garnishment was issues.

serviceChargeAmount.description: The requested service charge amount or adminstrative fee to be levied.

serviceChargeFeeIndicator.description: Specifies if a standard administration fee may be charged. If indicator is specified, the amount is not used.

maximumServiceChargeAmount.description: The maximum service charge amount or administration fee a processor can levy. If amount is specificed, the indicator is not used.

actualServiceChargeAmount.description: The actual service charge amount or adminstrative fee levied.

priority.description: The priority of the garnishment in relation to other Garnishments.

protectedEarningsAmount.description: The amount of earnings to be left to the employee when deducting this garnishment.

TaxableCompensationType.title: TaxableCompensationType
TaxableCompensationType.description: Type and monetary value reported in government reports. In the US, an example would be the Internal Revenue Service Form W-2.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the taxable compensation type.

WithholdingAmountType.title: WithholdingAmountType
WithholdingAmountType.description: Type and monetary value withheld from an worker. This may include taxes, premiums, and retirement withholdings.

description.description: Short phrase further describing the withholding amount.

IndirectCompensationType.title: IndirectCompensationType
IndirectCompensationType.description: The monetary value of compensation paid by the employer for a worker's voluntary and non-voluntary non-cash fringe benefits.

VoluntaryBenefitAmountType.title: VoluntaryBenefitAmountType
VoluntaryBenefitAmountType.description: The type and amount of voluntary benefit compensation.

typeCode.description: Types of voluntary benefits such as insurance, retirement or savings.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the benefit type.

amount.description: The monetary value of the voluntary benefit.

NonVoluntaryBenefitAmountType.title: NonVoluntaryBenefitAmountType
NonVoluntaryBenefitAmountType.description: Describes the type and amount of benefits paid by the employer.

typeCode.description: Types of non-voluntary benefits. In the US, this would include social security, medicare, unemployment and workers compensation.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the benefit type.

amount.description: The monetary value of the non-voluntary benefit.

totalVoluntaryBenefitAmount.description: Total monetary value of employer-paid contributions for discretionary fringe benefits provided to the worker, including insurance, retirement, and savings.

totalNonVoluntaryBenefitAmount.description: The total monetary value of compensation paid by the employer for a worker's legally required non-cash benefits. In the US, this would include employer contributions to Social Security, Medicare, FUTA, state Unemployment Insurance, Workers Compensation, and any other government-mandated benefits.

voluntaryBenefitAmount.description: The monetary value of employer-paid contributions for discretionary fringe benefits provided to the worker, including insurance, retirement, and savings.

nonVoluntaryBenefitAmount.description: The monetary value of compensation paid by the employer for workerss legally required non-cash fringe benefits, including employer contributions to Social Security, Medicare, FUTA, state Unemployment Insurance, Workers Compensation, and any other state-mandated benefits.

PayrollInstructionsType.title: PayrollInstructionsType
PayrollInstructionsType.description: Contains details to process a payroll for a person.

paymentInstructions.description: Instructions for payment method and amount.

deductionInstructions.description: Instructions for General and Benefits deductions.

PaymentDistributionType.description: Describes how to distribute the payment among the accounts.

amount.description: The amount of the payment.  This is only relevant for the secondary account in the event of a partial distribution.

percentage.description: The percentage of the payment. This is only relevant for the secondary account in the event of a partial distribution.

remainingBalanceIndicator.description: Specifies if the remaining amount should be applied to this account.

id.description: Identifies the payment instruction when there is more than one payment instruction.

sequence.description: Specifies in what order are the payments processed in the secondary accounts until the remainder is paid into the main account.

deploymentId.description: Provides a unique identifier to a specific deployment. This may be used when a person has multiple deployments within an organization. For example, a coach and math teacher at a school.

PayrollSetupType.title: PayrollSetupType
PayrollSetupType.description: Provides the information needed to setup a payroll.

personBase.description: General information about the person, e.g. id, birthdate and gender.

personLegal.description: Legal details about a person, e.g. passport, parents names, marital status.

person.description: Information about the person, including name, birthdate, legal ids, and marital status.

workLifeCycle.description: Describes the relationship of the worker, e.g. hire date, termination, hir.

deployment.description: Information about the person's position, organization, and work location.

paymentInstructions.description: Instructions for payment method and amount.

deductionInstructions.description: Instructions for General and Benefits deductions.

DirectCompensationType.title: DirectCompensationType
DirectCompensationType.description: The monetary compensation paid to a worker.

WorkedCompensationAmountType.title: WorkedCompensationAmountType
WorkedCompensationAmountType.description: Type and monetary value for time worked.

workedPayTypeCode.description: Type of compensation, e.g. holiday, overtime, shift differential, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the pay type.

workedPayAmount.description: The monetary value paid to the worker.

TimeOffCompensationAmountType.title: TimeOffCompensationAmountType
TimeOffCompensationAmountType.description: Type and monetary value of the time off.

timeOffPayType.description: Type of compensation, e.g. bereavement, jury duty, sick, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the time off type.

timeOffPayAmount.description: The monetary value paid to the worker.

salaryAmount.description: The agreed upon fixed or set monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services, that was not based on hours worked or production level. Salary is commonly paid in fixed intervals, for example, monthly payments of one-twelfth of the annual salary.

totalHourlyWageAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services based on hourly rates of pay and the number of hours worked. Includes pay for both regular hours (straight-time) and premium hours (overtime, shift differentials) worked.

totalPremiumHourlyWageAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker based on a premium hourly rate of pay and the number of premium hours worked.

totalPaidTimeoffAmount.description: The total monetary amount the employer paid to a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

totalHolidayPaidTimeOffAmount.description: The total monetary amount a worker was paid for absence from work on days of special religious, cultural, social, or patriotic significance, on which work and business ordinarily cease.

totalOtherCompensationAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker other than salary, hourly wages, and paid leave. Includes, but is not limited to bonuses, commissions, lump-sum, residuals, severance, tips, and incentive, piecework, production-based payments, and buy back of accrued leave.

regularHourlyWagesAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services.

premiumHourlyWagesAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services.

paidTimeOffAmount.description: The monetary amount the employer paid to a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

otherCompensationAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker other than salary, hourly wages, and paid leave. Includes, but is not limited to bonuses, commissions, lump-sum, residuals, severance, tips, and incentive, piecework, production-based payments, and buy back of accrued leave.

USBenefitTypeCodeList.title: USBenefitTypeCodeList
USBenefitTypeCodeList.description: Specifies non-voluntary benefits paid by the employer on behalf of the worker.

USTaxableCompensationTypeCodeList.title: USTaxableCompensationTypeCodeList
USTaxableCompensationTypeCodeList.description: Specifies the data reported in the U.S. Department of the Treasury, Internal Revenue Service Form W-2.

VoluntaryBenefitTypeCodeList.title: VoluntaryBenefitTypeCodeList
VoluntaryBenefitTypeCodeList.description: Specifies voluntary benefits paid by the employer on behalf of the worker.

InterviewAddressType.title: InterviewAddressType
InterviewAddressType.description: Contact information regarding the candidate to invite.

comments.description: Instructions or comments for the candidate.

PositionQuestionsType.title: PositionQuestionsType
PositionQuestionsType.description: The collection of questions for each interview type in which a candidate may participate.

QuestionType.title: QuestionType
QuestionType.description: Includes the questions to be asked during an interview.

mediaURL.description: The media URL if the question if the question is to be presented in some form of media.

responseType.description: video, audio, essay, multiple-choice, multiple-select, etc.

responsePrepTimeSeconds.description: How long after question presentation before the candidate must start answering the question.

maxResponseTimeSeconds.description: How long does the user have to answer the question once presented to them.

maxResponseLength.description: What is the maximum length of the response? Units will be a number representing the number of seconds or characters.

rerecordCount.description: Can the user rerecord their answer and if so, how many times? If not present option left to the interviewing system.

questionContext.description: The context for the question. Typically used with a group of questions related to a scenario.

reviewType.description: If reviewers can review by question, what type of review (text, multiple choice, multiple select).

responseChoice.description: If multiple choice or multiple select, the collection of possible responses.

ChoiceType.title: ChoiceType
ChoiceType.description: Provides a choice for the response or review.

text.description: The score for the selection if provided automated scoring for multiple-select or multiple-choice answers

value.description: The score for the selection if provided automated scoring for multiple-select or multiple-choice answers.

interviewFormatType.description: The type of interview (asynchronous video, asynchronous audio, live video, live audio, in-person).

questions.description: The collection of questions for a specific interview type.

defaultRerecordCount.description: The number of times an answer may be rerecorded.

comments.description: Additional information in support of position questions, such as a URL to interviewing system.

AsynchronousOrderType.title: AsynchronousOrderType
AsynchronousOrderType.description: Provides the information needed to order the Interview.

positionId.description: This is the Position Identifier assigned by the interviewing system.

positionTitle.description: The position title which might be presented to candidates.

externalPositionId.description: Identifier used by the requesting system to identify the position.

externalInterviewOrderId.description: Identifier used by the requesting system to identify the interview transaction.

interviewOrderId.description: This is the Interview Identifier assigned by the interviewing system.

interviewFormatType.description: The type of interview (asynchronous video, asynchronous audio, live video, live audio, in-person).

accountCode.description: Account Code for use for accounting purposes.

submissionDeadline.description: The default deadline, in hours or date, for an interview requested for this position.

languageCode.description: The default language in which the position is presented to the outside world.

comments.description: Additional information in support of the order, such as a URL to interviewing system.

taxId.description: A government assigned identifier to distinguish an organization. This typically is a country-level tax code. For example, Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) in the USA.

formerTaxId.description: The former government assigned identifier to distinguish organization. This typically is a country-level tax code. For example, Federal Employer Identification Number (FEIN) in the USA.

legalId.description: An identifier of the organization for legal purposes. This could be a company, state, or other kind of identifier. For example, Data Universal Numbering System, abbreviated as DUNS.

industryIdentifiers.description: The types of industry to which the organization belongs. The Industry identifiers could be referenced to a standard taxonomy (such as NAICS) or a custom taxonomy.

headCount.description: The number of employees in the organization. Depending on the organization, this could include full-time, part-time and contractors.

revenue.description: The amount of revenue of the organization, typically from the most recent fiscal year.

description.description: A description or quick summary of the organization.

geographicResponsibilityCode.description: A code that classifies the geographic level at which the organization operates.

ownershipType.description: A code that classifies the ownership of the organization.

organizationActivity.description: A description of the business activities conducted at the organization, listed by approximate percentage of revenue or sales associated with each activity.

stockSymbol.description: The stock symbol for the organization. The stock exchange symbol should also be included. Example: NYSE:XOM representing Exxon Mobile on the New York Stock Exchange.

workEnvironmentCode.description: A code to represent the working environment of the organization. E.g., Office, Workshop, Factory, etc.

contacts.description: Specific people at the organization who are contacts.

tradeName.description: Trade name of the organizationor doing-business-as (DBA).

statusHistory.description: A history of the organization statuses; e.g the date and code. e.g. sold, temporarily closed, permanently closed, merged, acquired, etc.

domainName.description: The internet domain to help identify the organization and a reference to find additional information.

parentCompanyTaxId.description: The tax ID of the parent company if this company is a wholly owned subsidiary of another company.

parentCompanyName.description: The legal name of the parent company if this company is a wholly owned subsidiary of another company.

typeCode.description: A code classifying the work location type e.g., Distribution center, Headquarters, Plant, etc.

EmployerEstablishmentType.description: Information to identify and reference a specific establishment within an organization.

industryIdentifiers.description: The types of industry to which the establishment belongs. The Industry identifiers could be referenced to a standard taxonomy (such as NAICS) or a custom taxonomy.

businessFunction.description: Describe the business functions performed at the location, e.g., administrative, warehouse, retail, professional services, information technology, engineering, R&D, etc.

establishmentActivity.description: A description of the business activities conducted at the establishment, listed by approximate percentage of revenue or sales associated with each activity.

tradeName.description: Trade name of the establishment or doing-business-as (DBA).

statusHistory.description: Specifies the current status of the establishment, e.g. sold, temporarily closed, permanently closed, merged, acquired, etc.

PartyType.description: A collection of information about the party who is the supplier/customer/requester of the associated entity.

CompetencyDimensionType.title: CompetencyDimensionType
CompetencyDimensionType.description: A measurable characteristic of a competency. Examples might include 'frequency of use,' 'level of interest,' etc.

dimensionType.description: A code classifying the type of competency dimension.

CompetencyType.title: CompetencyType
CompetencyType.description: Represents competency types in HR Open Standards.

SpecifiedCompetencyType.title: SpecifiedCompetencyType
SpecifiedCompetencyType.description: A specified competency is a reference to a particular competency at a specified level of proficiency.

name.description: Competency name.

PersonCompetencyType.title: PersonCompetencyType
PersonCompetencyType.description: A specified person competency is a competency within the context of a personal record (profile, appraisal, assessment) assessed or asserted at specified level of proficiency.

competencyIds.description: A unique identifier for a competency definition.

taxonomyIds.description: The identifier for categorization of competencies in an HR context.

competencyName.description: A human readable, descriptive name for the given competency.

description.description: Brief description of the named competency.

proficiencyLevel.description: A minimum level of proficiency for a competency associated with a position, role, course, or other item. The proficiency level is expressed as a score, a point scale, or a mark among range of values.

experienceMeasure.description: The duration of experience associated with the given entity. For example, this may be experience asserted or claimed by a candidate as evidence of a competency. Or it may be the assertion of a competency evidence policy or requirement for the duration of experience associated with a position or role.

interestLevel.description: A rating of a person's interest associated with a competency.

CompetencyWeightType.title: CompetencyWeightType
CompetencyWeightType.description: A number expressing the relative importance of a particular component (e.g., a position competency) among sibling components. Weights are most frequently expressed a percentage (where the weights assigned to individual sibling competencies would total 100 percent when totaled), but they may be expressed using another numeric scale.

value.description: Value for the weightType.

schemeId.description: An identifier used to distinguish the relevant scoring scheme to which the weight belongs.

schemeName.description: A name for scheme in which the score is expressed.

interval.description: The stop points between minimum and maximum.

maximumScore.description: Highest score in the weight range.

minimumScore.description: Lowest score in the weight range.

CompetencyEvidenceType.title: CompetencyEvidenceType
CompetencyEvidenceType.description: A document or other record providing evidence of a competency or that is treated as a proxy for the existence of the competency. Examples include: an assessment result; a performance appraisal; an educational degree; a supervisor's observation; etc.

evidenceTypeCode.description: A code categorizing the type of evidence that substantiates a related competency. For example, 'assessment', 'degree', 'performance appraisal', etc.

evidenceName.description: A name or label for the evidence.

descriptions.description: Description of the evidence requirement.

evidenceRequirementsId.description: An identifier for a policy associated with or governing the type of evidence. For example, a policy setting a confidence level or minimum requirement for the associated evidence.

verificationDate.description: The date on which the associated information or fact was verified.

verificationSourceName.description: The name of the service, person, or agent from which the verification was obtained.

PositionCompetencyType.title: PositionCompetencyType
PositionCompetencyType.description: A qualified position competency has a specified required and/or desired level of proficiency and has an explicit or implicit level of importance (weight) among sibling competencies associated with a position.

competencyId.description: A unique identifier for a competency definition.

competencyName.description: A human readable, descriptive name for the given competency.

competencyIds.description: A unique identifier for a competency definition.

taxonomyIds.description: The identifier for categorization of competencies in an HR context.

competencyName.description: A human readable, descriptive name for the given competency.

weight.description: A number expressing the relative importance of a particular component (e.g., a position competency) among sibling components. Weights are most frequently expressed a percentage (where the weights assigned to individual sibling competencies would total 100 percent when totaled), but they may be expressed using another numeric scale.

requiredProficiencyLevel.description: A minimum level of proficiency for a competency  associated with a position, role, course, or other item. The proficiency level is expressed as a score, a point scale, or a mark among range of values.

desiredProficiencyLevel.description: DefinitionText>An optimum or ideal level of proficiency for a competency with respect to an associated position, role, course, or other item. The proficiency level is expressed as a score, a point scale, or a mark among range of values.

proficiencyAcquistionDifficulty.description: A rating or score representing the difficulty of the particular competency to acquire.

competencyClassificationCode.description: A code that categorizes a competency according to a classification system. This classification system usually would be set within a source competency model or taxonomy.

MessageInclusion.title: MessageInclusion

type.description: The purpose of the message.

code.description: The code that classifies the message.

text.description: Human readable text of the message.

ResourceMessageInclusion.description: A response type for communicating processing results of a single resource.

resourceResultStatusCode.description: A code classifying the event associated with the waiting rule.

messages.description: A list of messages concerning the processing of the resource.

ResponseMessageBaseInclusion.description: A response to a request to process a list of items.

messageDateTime.description: The date & time that the response message instance was created.

requestId.description: The identifier for the request to which a confirm message is related. In the asynchronous processing case, this identifier may be used to refer to the processing job that is servicing a request.

requestProcessingStatusCode.description: The processing status code for the request.

BulkResponseMessageType.description: A response message for communicating processing results of a request to process a set of resources, a bulk request.

resourceMessages.description: A list of messages concerning the processing of the individual resources of the bulk request.

AtomicResponseMessageType.title: AtomicResponseMessageType
AtomicResponseMessageType.description: A response message for communicating processing results of a request to process a single resource, an atomic request.

requestResultStatusCode.description: The result status code for the request.

messages.description: A list of messages concerning the processing of an atomic request.

disability.description: A type of disability that a person has.

tobaccoUserIndicator.description: An indicator that a person is a tobacco user.

hairColor.description: The color of the hair of a person.

eyeColor.description: The color of the eyes of a person.

identifyingMarks.description: A list of identifying marks of a person.

age.description: The age of a person (in years).

bloodType.description: The blood type of a person.

PersonBaseType.title: PersonBaseType
PersonBaseType.description: Represents common data about a person.

legalId.description: The legal identifier of a person. The issuer is most likely a country or state.

previousLegalId.description: The previous legal identifier of a person. The issuer is most likely a country or state.

birthDate.description: The birth date of a person.

citizenship.description: The citizenships that a person holds. This is a legal citizenship in a country (as opposed to nationality which may or may not be a country).

residenceCountry.description: The country (or countries) where a person currently resides.

militaryStatus.description: The military status of a person.

ethnicity.description: The ethnicity (or ethnicities) of a person. A country may define which of these terms (race, nationality, ethnicity) be used and how they are defined. One or more properties may be used by a country. A predefined country list allows a person to specify their ethnicity.

PersonLegalType.title: PersonLegalType
PersonLegalType.description: Represents person along with legal data.

disabilityIndicator.description: Legal details about a person, e.g. passport, parents names, marital status.

PersonNameType.title: PersonNameType
PersonNameType.description: A component for capturing summary or fine-grain data comprising a person's name.

formattedName.description: The formatted name of a person, as it would be written out together (for example, on a mailing label).

legal.description: The legal name of a person (typically used if it differs from family name).

given.description: The given name of a person.

preferred.description: The preferred name of a person (if it differs from given name).

middle.description: The middle names or initials of a person.

family.description: The family name (or surname) of a person.

familyPrefix.description: The prefix of a family name, e.g. van der, de jong.

alias.description: An alias or (or also known as) name of a person.

formerFamily.description: The former family name of a person (used if the person's name was changed).

formerFamilyPrefix.description: The prefix of the former family name, e.g. van der, de jong.

preferredSalutationCode.description: The salutation used to address a person (such as Dr., Mr., Mrs.).

generationAffixCode.description: The generational designation attached to the end of a person's name (such as Jr., Sr., II, III).

qualificationAffixCode.description: The professional designation attached to the end of a person's name (such as M.Sc., Ph.D).

titleAffixCode.description: The title designation attached to the end of a person's name (such as Esq., K.B.E.).

script.description: Script used to represent the name.

PersonLegalInclusion.title: PersonLegalInclusion
PersonLegalInclusion.description: A collection of demographic and personal data about a person.

fatherName.description: The surname of the father of the person.

motherName.description: The surname of the mother of the person.

race.description: The identified race(s) of the person. A country may define which of these terms (race, nationality, ethnicity) will be used and how they are defined. One or more properties may be used by a country. A predefined country list allows a person to specify their race.

birthPlace.description: The birth place of the person.

deathDate.description: If the person is deceased, the legal date that the person died.

nationality.description: The nationality (or nationalities) of the person. A country may define which of these terms (race, nationality, ethnicity) be used and how they are defined. One or more properties may be used by a country. A predefined country list allows a person to specify their nationality.

maritalStatus.description: The marital status of the person.

maritalStatusDate.description: The date for the marital status of the person.

religion.description: The religions of the person of the person.

studentType.description: The type of student (if the person is a student). Typically used to indicate 'full-time' or 'part-time' status.

studentIndicator.description: An indicator as to whether the individual currently is enrolled as a student within a specific class of educational institution. This is component is attributed with effective dating.

studentStatus.description: The status of the student (if the person is a student). Typically used to indicate special states such as 'Suspended'.

employmentPermits.description: The permissions of a person to work (within an administrative unit).

PersonType.title: PersonType
PersonType.description: A schema that represents all of the information of a person.

SpecifiedPersonType.description: Contains information to identify a person associated with the interaction or entity.

documentType.description: The type of document, e.g. Passport, Visa, National Registration Card.

PersonReferenceType.description: A schema to reference to a person.

ResponsibleType.description: A collection of information about the person who is the submitter/approver of the associated document.

person.description: Contains information identifying the person who has the role of submitter/approver.

datetime.description: The date the related document, report, or related entity was communicated to a receiving or approving entity.

PersonPhysicalType.description: A schema that represents a person along with their physical data.

ResponsibleInclusion.description: The people who are submitters and/or approvers information for an entity.

CostAllocationType.description: Contains percentage table per identifier of an account, department, or other entity to which an item should be allocated.

RemunerationOrDeductionType.title: RemunerationOrDeductionType
RemunerationOrDeductionType.description: Instruction for benefits and other deductions.

validFrom.description: Valid from/to dates for one time deductions are the dates when the deduction was incurred, not when it was to be deducted. For recurring deductions, the valid from/to dates are the processing dates.

validTo.description: Valid from/to dates for one time deductions are the dates when the deduction was incurred, not when it was to be deducted. For recurring deductions, the valid from/to dates are the processing dates.

id.description: The identifier of the deduction.

deploymentId.description: Provides a unique identifier to a specific deployment. This may be used when a person has multiple deployments within an organization. For example, a coach and math teacher at a school.

statusCode.description: The action to be performed, Default is Create. Create - Add a new entry, Update is to add the current values to any existing values.

intervalCode.description: The frequency at which an earning is 'earned'. E.g. how often the worker is paid the associated earning.

oneTimeIndicator.description: True for a one time deduction and False for a recurring deduction.

totalTransactions.description: The total number of deductions within the transaction.

sequence.description: The order of this deduction within the deductions of this transaction.

typeCode.description: The type of payment or deduction. E.g. salary, overtime, benefit, court order, garnishment, etc. This provides for a grouping of similar items, e.g. there may be many different Pension Deductions each with its own ID but they all have a Type of Pensions.

subTypeCode.description: The category within the deduction type. E.g. for garnishments this could be creditor, child support, etc. For benefits, this could be medical, car, voluntary insurance.

referenceId.description: The third party reference for the deduction. I.e. court order number, union membership number, etc.

requestedAmount.description: The amount to be deducted, if available.

requestedPercentage.description: The percent to be withheld. For example, an elected 3% retirement deduction.

basis.description: Used in conjunction with the requestedPercentage to calculate the remuneration or deduction amount in cases where the basisAmount is not known to the receiving system.

items.description: Basis Item

basisId.description: An identifier for the basis instance.

basisAmount.description: The monetary amount on which the remuneration or deduction amount is calculated.

requestedRate.description: The rate to be used for the number of units being processed, if available.

requestedUnitType.description: The Type of the Units, for example, Hours, Days, Pieces made, etc.

requestedUnits.description: The number of units to be processed.

actualAmount.description: The amount actually deducted after processing payroll.

actualPaymentDate.description: The date on which the actual amount was taken after processing payroll.

originalBalanceAmount.description: The total amount to be withheld over the life of this deduction.

remainingBalanceAmount.description: The current amount of the deduction after processing payroll.

receivingParty.description: Information about the person or organization receiving the payment.

personName.description: The name of the person receiving the payment.

personCommunication.description: The phone, address, and/or email of the person receiving the payment.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization receiving payment.

employerAmount.description: The amount the employer contributes to the deduction type. For example, $10 for certification dues.

employerPercentage.description: The percent the employer contributes to the deduction type. For example 4% for retirement.

RemunerationPackageType.title: RemunerationPackageType
RemunerationPackageType.description: Terms offered or agreed regarding remuneration for a position. May include pay as well as benefits in-kind.

basisCode.description: A code classifying the primary method of payment for the associated position or employment. This classifies the method by which remuneration for a position is provided or calculated.

benefitsSummary.description: A summary of the offered benefits.

WorkAllocationType.title: WorkAllocationType
WorkAllocationType.description: The payrate for a block of items completed.

PaymentMethodType.title: PaymentMethodType
PaymentMethodType.description: Defines how a payment is paid.

methodType.description: The manner is which a payment is made. E.g. Direct Deposit, Check, etc.

accountId.description: An account ID within a bank into which a payroll payment is deposited. The schemeID would include the word 'IBAN' or 'SWIFT' to reference the ID Type.

accountType.description: A bank account into which a payment is deposited.

nameOnAccount.description: The name of the person on the bank account

bankId.description: This is a number or identifier for a bank used in the context of electronic funds transfer. Usually, only a single BankID needs to be specified in the context of a given transaction. The bankId may have different names in different parts of the world. E.g. BIC in Europe, Routing Number in the US, and Sort Code in UK.

countryCode.description: The country code where the bank is located.

currencyCode.description: The currency of the payment to be made.

RemunerationRangeType.title: RemunerationRangeType
RemunerationRangeType.description: The minimum and maximum range of work compensation.

typeCode.description: The type of remuneration (e.g. BasePay, Bonus).

referenceAmount.description: A reference to an associated monetary amount. A monetary quantity. An attribute is available to express the currency in which the amount is expressed.

minimumAmount.description: The minimum amount a person is willing to accept or an organization is willing to pay for a position.

maximumAmount.description: The maximum amount a person is willing to accept or an organization is willing to pay for a position.

intervalCode.description: An interval of time or other basis used to express a rate of pay or remuneration.

DirectCompensationType_1.title: DirectCompensationType
DirectCompensationType_1.description: The monetary compensation paid to a worker.

WorkedCompensationAmountType.title: WorkedCompensationAmountType
WorkedCompensationAmountType.description: Type and monetary value for time worked.

workedPayTypeCode.description: Type of compensation, e.g. holiday, overtime, shift differential, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the pay type.

workedPayAmount.description: The monetary value paid to the worker.

TimeOffCompensationAmountType.title: TimeOffCompensationAmountType
TimeOffCompensationAmountType.description: Type and monetary value of the time off.

timeOffPayType.description: Type of compensation, e.g. bereavement, jury duty, sick, etc.

description.description: A short phrase further describing the time off type.

timeOffPayAmount.description: The monetary value paid to the worker.

salaryAmount.description: The agreed upon fixed or set monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services, that was not based on hours worked or production level. Salary is commonly paid in fixed intervals, for example, monthly payments of one-twelfth of the annual salary.

totalHourlyWageAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services based on hourly rates of pay and the number of hours worked. Includes pay for both regular hours (straight-time) and premium hours (overtime, shift differentials) worked.

totalPremiumHourlyWageAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker based on a premium hourly rate of pay and the number of premium hours worked.

totalPaidTimeoffAmount.description: The total monetary amount the employer paid to a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

totalHolidayPaidTimeOffAmount.description: The total monetary amount a worker was paid for absence from work on days of special religious, cultural, social, or patriotic significance, on which work and business ordinarily cease.

totalOtherCompensationAmount.description: The total monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker other than salary, hourly wages, and paid leave. Includes, but is not limited to bonuses, commissions, lump-sum, residuals, severance, tips, and incentive, piecework, production-based payments, and buy back of accrued leave.

regularHourlyWagesAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services.

premiumHourlyWagesAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid by the employer to a worker for her or his services.

paidTimeOffAmount.description: The monetary amount the employer paid to a worker for any type of absence from work including vacation, sickness, bereavement, maternity, family care, jury duty, education, military duty, administrative time off, sabbatical, or other personal leave. Includes compensatory time off (CTO) when used.

otherCompensationAmount.description: The monetary amount of cash or cash-equivalent (currency, coin, check, or direct deposit) compensation paid to a worker other than salary, hourly wages, and paid leave. Includes, but is not limited to bonuses, commissions, lump-sum, residuals, severance, tips, and incentive, piecework, production-based payments, and buy back of accrued leave.

type.description: A media type, as described in RFC 2046

binaryEncoding.description: A content encoding scheme, as described in RFC 2045

pathStart.description: Instances' URIs must start with this value for this schema to apply to them

href.description: a URI template, as defined by RFC 6570, with the addition of the $, ( and ) characters for pre-processing

rel.description: relation to the target resource of the link

targetSchema.description: JSON Schema describing the link target

mediaType.description: media type (as defined by RFC 2046) describing the link target

method.description: method for requesting the target of the link (e.g. for HTTP this might be "GET" or "DELETE")

encType.description: The media type in which to submit data along with the request

schema.description: Schema describing the data to submit along with the request

JSON_Patch.title: JSON Patch
JSON_Patch.description: A JSON Schema describing a JSON Patch

patch.description: List of patch operations to perform

value.description: The value to add, replace or test.

SearchOrderType.title: SearchOrderType
SearchOrderType.description: Specifying order information of search results.

GeoDistanceQueryType.title: GeoDistanceQueryType
GeoDistanceQueryType.description: Type for geo distance queries - radial distance around center geo point.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to which the condition applies.

geoPoint.description: Requested center (geo point) for the distance calculation.

weight.description: Criterion importance. Criterion can be set as required, or a numerical weight may be assigned.

id.description: Criterion identifier. Can be used to refer to the criterion later, e.g. in search result details explanation.

commonPropertyPath.description: Common property path that refers to the nested structure instance.

RangeNumberQueryType.title: RangeNumberQueryType
RangeNumberQueryType.description: Range query type based on numerical data.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to which the condition applies.

unitCode.description: Optional unit code to specify the numerical values.

WeightType.title: WeightType
WeightType.description: Weight that describes the importance of the search criteria.

maximumValue.description: Highest score in the weight range for the search criteria to be considered matched.

minimumValue.description: Lowest score in the weight range for the search criteria to be considered matched.

isRequired.description: The search criterion is required to be in the matching items.

minimumScoreToFulfillRequired.description: Lowest score in order to fulfill a required criterion. Only relevant for cases of partial match, e.g. by affinities.

ReferencedPropertyValueType.title: ReferencedPropertyValueType
ReferencedPropertyValueType.description: Type for representing a property referenced by its path with its value(s).

BooleanAndQueryType.title: BooleanAndQueryType
BooleanAndQueryType.description: Type to implement a 'boolean AND' query.

BooleanQueryType.title: BooleanQueryType
BooleanQueryType.description: Set of all boolean query types.

TermsQueryType.title: TermsQueryType
TermsQueryType.description: Type for fixed term / keyword queries.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to which the condition applies.

matchMode.description: Mode for matching - to fulfill the condition: 'allOf': all search values have to be found, 'anyOf': at least one search value has to be found, 'oneOf': exactly one search value has to be found, 'noneOf': none search value is found.

propertyPaths.description: Path of the properties to which the condition applies.

options.description: Further parameters to specify the behavior of the fulltext search.

RangeDateTimeQueryType.title: RangeDateTimeQueryType
RangeDateTimeQueryType.description: Range query type based on date and time data.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to which the condition applies.

RequestedMatchedObjectDescriptorType.title: RequestedMatchedObjectDescriptorType
RequestedMatchedObjectDescriptorType.description: Type to define a matched object descriptor, which is used to define the fields from the matching results to be returned.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property that should be returned.

options.description: Further parameters. May include other information relevant for property data.

LeafQueryType.title: LeafQueryType
LeafQueryType.description: Set of all leaf query types, i.e. without any substructure, which look for a particular value in a particular field, such as the fulltext match, terms, geo distance, or range queries.

RangeQueryType.title: RangeQueryType
RangeQueryType.description: Set of all range query types.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to which the condition applies.

geoPolygon.description: The geographical polygon of geographical points. In order to fulfill the query/criterion, the location geo points must fall inside the polygon.

GeoPolygonType.title: GeoPolygonType
GeoPolygonType.description: A geographical polygon - consisting of an ordered set of geographical points. A minimum of 4 points is required. The first and the last position should be identical to be a valid polygon.

BooleanOrQueryType.title: BooleanOrQueryType
BooleanOrQueryType.description: Type to implement a 'boolean OR' query.

ParameterType.title: ParameterType
ParameterType.description: Generic parameter type (key/value) used to further qualify the search and/or result behavior.

BooleanNotQueryType.title: BooleanNotQueryType
BooleanNotQueryType.description: Type to implement a 'boolean NOT' query.

count.description: Number of items in this result set.

countAll.description: Number of all items that match the search criteria.

executionCode.description: A result code from the execution of the search.

items.description: Search result items (of this set).

matchedObjectDescriptors.description: Descriptors of the matched object/item. Remark: usually correspond to the requested descriptors as given in the search query.

relevanceRank.description: Rank according to relevance of the search.

relevanceScore.description: Relevance score - usually in numerical values from 0.0 (no overestimation) to 1.0 (full overestimation with search criteria).

relevanceScoreIsRequiredMissedIndicator.description: Relevance score indicator that at least one required criterion is missed in the item. Remark: Only needed if such search results are forced to be considered.

relevanceScoreDetails.description: Details about the score or evaluation of the item to help explain its relevance to the search criteria.

RelevanceScoreDetailsItemType.title: RelevanceScoreDetailsItemType
RelevanceScoreDetailsItemType.description: Detailed information about the relevance score evaluation.

searchCriterionReference.description: Reference to related search criterion. Remark: refers to 'searchCriterion.id.value'.

fulfillmentScore.description: Fulfillment score - usually in values from 0.0 (no relevance or fulfillment) to 1.0 (full relevance or complete fulfillment with search criterion).

fulfillmentScoreIsRequiredMissedIndicato.description: Fulfillment score indicator that a required criterion is missed.

fulfillmentData.description: Further information about fulfillment evaluation for this criterion.

OrderCriterionType.title: OrderCriterionType
OrderCriterionType.description: Type to define a single order criterion.

propertyPath.description: Path of the property to be ordered by.

options.description: Further parameters. May include additional information relevant for ordering.

SearchLimitType.title: SearchLimitType
SearchLimitType.description: Specifying limit information of a search result.

from.description: (Index of) first item to be returned. A minimum value of 0 should be used.

size.description: Number of items to be returned.

limit.description: The limit of the number of items to return in the search result.

orders.description: The order of the items in the search result.

searchCriteria.description: The search criteria to use when executing the search.

scoreThreshold.description: The score threshold (minimum and/or maximum) of the items in the search result.

requestedMatchedObjectDescriptors.description: Requested descriptors (attributes) of the search result items. Elements should be selected using the JSONPath notation.

OrganizationAffiliationType.title: OrganizationAffiliationType
OrganizationAffiliationType.description: Contains information about a person's affiliation with a trade, professional, or similar organization or group formed around a common purpose or cause.

organization.description: The specific organization to which the person is affiliated.

affiliationTypeCode.description: The type of association or organization with which a person is affiliated. In most contexts, this would be an organizational affiliation other than that with an employer. Typically, would be an affiliation with an association, trade organization, or union.

memberId.description: The membership identifier of the person at the affiliated organization.

role.description: The role of the person at the affiliated organization.

startDate.description: The start date of the person at the affiliated organization.

endDate.description: The end date of the person at the affiliated organization.

descriptions.description: Other descriptions of the affiliated organization.

attachmentReferences.description: Related attachment references for the affiliated organization.

PublicationType.title: PublicationType
PublicationType.description: Basic type that contains all properties common to publication, which could be print or electronic.

id.description: An identifier of the publication.

type.description: Type of publication, such as a book or article.

date.description: The date that the publication was published.

abstract.description: A summary or abstract of the publication.

contributors.description: A list of contributors to the publication.

name.description: The name of the contributor.

copyrights.description: A list of copyright holders and year when the copyright was issued.

year.description: The year when the copyright was issued to the owner.

attachmentReferences.description: A reference to an attachment related to the publication.

journal.description: The journal where the publication was published.

issn.description: The ISSN (International Standard Serial Number) issued for the publication.

volume.description: The volume of the publication if the publication is part of a series.

issue.description: The issue of the publication if the publication is part of a series.

pages.description: The pages related to the publication if the published material is only part of a larger work.

edition.description: The edition or version number of the publication.

chapters.description: The chapters related to the publication if the published material is only part of a larger work.

isbn.description: The ISBN representing the publication. ISBN is an International Standard Book Number, which is typically 13 digits.

publisherLocation.description: The location of the publisher of the publication.

event.description: The event that is related to a publication (i.e. a book launch or a conference).

EventType.title: EventType
